column12: CONJUNTO PARA ENCOFRADOS
column13: CONJUNTO PARA ENCOFRADOS. ESTE CONJUNTO ES DEL TIPO QUE COMPRENDE UNAS PORTACORREAS (1), LAS CORREAS (2) QUE SE APOYAN SOBRE ELLAS Y SOPORTAN LAS PLACAS DE ENCOFRADO (4), Y LOS PUNTALES (9) QUE SOSTIENEN TODO EL CONJUNTO, SIENDO OBJETO DE LA INVENCION QUE LAS CORREAS (2) QUEDEN PERFECTAMENTE POSICIONADAS Y ESTABILIZADAS SOBRE LAS PORTACORREAS (1) Y NO SE DESPLACEN Y/O VUELQUEN LATERALMENTE, EVITANDOSE LOS CONTRATIEMPOS Y ACCIDENTES QUE SE PRODUCEN CON RELATIVA ASIDUIDAD EN LOS CONJUNTO DEL INDICADO TIPO. PARA ELLO, LAS PORTACORREAS (1) PRESENTAN SOLIDARIZADAS SOBRE SU PARTE SUPERIOR, EN LAS ZONAS DONDE SE APOYARAN LAS CORREAS (2) Y OTROS LARGUEROS (5) QUE PUEDA NECESITAR EL CONJUNTO, SENDOS PERFILES EN U (3, 3'') DISPUESTOS TRANSVERSALMENTE EN LOS QUE ENCAJARAN DICHAS CORREAS (2) Y LARGUEROS (5), CUYOS PERFILES (3, 3'') PUEDEN SOBRESALIR DE LAS PORTACORREAS (1) PARA OFRECER MAS ZONA DE APOYO A LAS CORREAS (2), PRESENTANDO EN ESTE CASO BAJO LAS PARTES SOBRESALIENTES CORRESPONDIENTES ELEMENTOS-CARTELA (6) DE REFUERZO SOLIDARIZADOS A ELLAS Y A LAS PORTACORREAS (1).

column12: Improvements made to the subject of main patent No P8800224 for Assembly for shuttering (forms, falsework)
column13: The object of these improvements is to eliminate the additional elements that are attached to the purlin holders 3' according to said main patent, to make it possible for the lateral quadrangular profiles 5 of the purlins to be flush with the intermediate support beams 10 in the event that plates or long boards 6' should have to be supported, simplifying the whole and reducing its manufacturing cost. For this purpose, the purlins 1a are higher and the abovementioned quadrangular profiles 5 are attached at an intermediate region of their sides, so that said profiles 5 lie flush at the top with the upper face of the intermediate beams 10 at the same time as the purlins 1a bear directly on the purlin holders 3', their lower part being housed between the projections 4 also attached directly to said purlin holders 3'.

column12: Assembly for formwork (shuttering)
column13: This assembly is of the type which comprises strap carriers 1, the straps 2 which rest on them and support the formwork plates 4, and the struts 9 which support the entire assembly, the object of the invention being that the straps 2 should be perfectly positioned and stabilized on the strap carriers 1, should not move and/or turn laterally, avoiding the setbacks and accidents which arise relatively frequently in assemblies of the said type. To this end, the strap carriers 1 have, secured on their upper part, in the regions where the straps 2 and other beams (supports) 5 which the assembly might need will rest, individual U-shaped sections (profiles) 3, 3', arranged transversely, in which said straps 2 and beams 5 will fit, which sections 3, 3' can project from the strap carriers 1 to offer a greater area of support to the straps 2, having, in such a case, under the projecting parts, corresponding heel plate (bracket) elements 6 for reinforcement, secured to said parts and to the strap carriers 1.

column12: RECYCLABLE OR COMPOSTABLE FILM REPLACEMENTS OF PLASTIC ALUMINUM LAMINATE PACKAGING
column13: The invention describes the use of magnetic platelet particles as a multifunctional additive to various formulations of polyolefin plastic films usable to fabricate packaging and to provide said packaging with similar barrier properties as aluminium metallizations or other gas barriers, with the added benefit of allowing separation and recovery of the packaging by magnetic means. Such novel additives, films and packaging are environmentally friendly and food-safe, so that after use they can be either recovered for reuse, composted, or dumped in the environment to biodegrade. The invention comprises various types of films comprising the additive and methods to improve the properties of said films.
column15: ESPINOSA DURAN DAVID JOSE

column12: isolador tensionador para cabos de cercas elétricas
column13: ISOLADOR TENSIONADOR PARA CABOS DE CERCAS ELéTRICAS. Refere-se a presente invenção a um dispositivo que parafusado às hastes de sustentação dos cabos de aço, normalmente inox, serve para manter o isolamento necessário para que estes cabos que conduzem alta-voltagem não se encostem entre si, já que correm paralelos por toda a extensão das cercas elétricas e não devem encostar entre si para evitar curto-circuitos, da mesma forma que devem manter o isolamento com as próprias hastes onde os isoladores são fixados, evitando fugas de voltagem ou lançamento de faíscas. Isto que é descrito acima todos os isoladores no mercado já fazem, este, porém, além disso, mantém o esticamento desses cabos de forma permanente, compemsando os afrouxamentos temporários ocasionados pelas distensêes/contrações que eles sofrem em função das mudanças de temperatura, sofrendo, ainda, com a queda de pequenos galhos ou arbustos e pelo pouso de aves e enrosco de linhas de pipas, que fazem com que a distenção seja inevitável e que este isolador tensionador recupera permanentemente com a utilização de uma mola espiral tensora embutida no seu interior esticando os cabos, sem necessidade de ajustes manuais.
column15: ESPINOSA JOSE ANTONIO ROMANO

column12: desodorizador de bacia sanitária
column13: DEOSODORIZADOR DE BACIA SANITáRIA Refere-se a presente invenção a um equipamento, movido a energia elétrica e para aspirar os gases despejados na Bacia Sanitária durante a defecção, através dos furos e dutos de água próprios para lavagem da Bacia Sanitária, e com o auxilio de uma nova válvula ar/água que permite direcionar os gases rumo a um cjto. Exaustor/Filtrante e direcionar a água, advinda da descarga, rumo à Bacia para efetuar sua limpeza, fechando o duto dos gazes, evitando a inundação do cjto. Exaustor Filtrante, salientando que os gazes despejados à Bacia Sanitária durante a defecção, são aspirados por forte motor elétrico e forçados a passar por um filtro de carvão ativado, similar ao já utilizado nos aparelhos de ar condicionado dos automóveis, para desta forma, remover os maus odores e devolver o ar, isento de cheiros repugnantes, ao próprio banheiro.
column15: ESPINOSA JOSE ANTONIO ROMANO

column12: alerta cardìaco
column13: ALERTA CARDíACO refere-se a presente invenção a um conj unto de equipamentos eletrdnícos capazes de acompanhar os batimentos cardiacos do seu portador e ao identificar súbita e brusca alteração desses batímentos,como sempre ocorre nos casos de perigo, mal- estares subítos, ameaças tisícas, acidentes, etc., acionar automaticamente o alerta sem necessidade de apertar qualquer botão, informando a Central de Emergencia contratada, via telefone ceLular, radio-celular ou similar, acoplado ao Modulo de Alerta, junto com um receptor de GPS, alertando da necessidade de auxílio urgente ao seu portador, informando, até o local onde se encontra, informado pelo (IPS e em casos de seqúestro ou quando o usuarto se movimentar, permitir o seu rastreamento, inclusive por ìnternet, facilitando seu resgate. com isto se elimina a necessidade de apertar "Botões de Pânico", em locais fixos e nem sempre acessiveis, muitas das vezes por medo dos Porteiros, Zeladores, Seguranças, etc serem descobertos acionando esses botões e responsabilizados pelos marginais. O ALERTA CARDTACO, serve também para emergências de saúde onde a pessoa se veja ímpossibilidade de qualquer acionamento manual apesar de possuir também um botão de acionamento manual do alerta
column15: ESPINOSA JOSE ANTONIO ROMANO

column12: MICROELECTRONIC DEVICE FOR RECORDING THE ELECTRIC SIGNAL OF THE HEART, TEMPERATURE, RESPIRATORY FREQUENCY, CARDIAC FREQUENCY AND CHANGE IN SPATIAL POSITIONING.
column13: Described is a microelectronic device for the record and process of physiological parameters such as heart electric signal, cardiac frequency, respiratory frequency, temperature and spatial positioning, in order to determine the existence of a variation with regard to the normal pattern of each of the physiological parameters. In case a variation occurs, three type of alarm would be emitted depending on the severity in the patient's health condition, the first alarm only storing the data in the memory of the device, the second alarm emitting a warning signal and sending the stored data corresponding to 30 seconds prior and subsequent the generation thereof, said data will be sent by a wireless communication channel to an external device intended to send the information to a specialist physician. The third type of alarm is emitted when the condition of the patient is considered as severe and requires an immediate attention. The device may be configured from a computer for mainly indica ting the recording period of each one of the parameters to be compared against the normal pattern.
column15: LOBATO JOSE AMADO ESPINOSA

column12: aerofólio com depressões cÈncavas na superficie
column13: AEROFóLIO COM DEPRESSõES CÈNCAVAS NA SUPERFìCIE. Refere-se a presente invenção a um Aerofólio, Asa, Hélice, Palheta de Turbina, etc., que por sua característica de funcionamento oferecem resistência ao avanço, dentro do meio onde são utilizados, sejam gasosos ou líquidos, com conseqúente exigência de força para vence-lo, força esta maior quanto maior for sua velocidade e cresce em Progressão Geométrica à velocidade aplicada. Contrariando os atuais Aerofólios de superficie totalmente lisa este possui concavidades distribuídas em pontos estratégicos, onde a resistência ao avanço é maior, permite a redução dessa resistência, traduzindo-se em forte redução da energia gasta para o seu acionamento, economia de combustível, energia elétrica, etc., a até pela redução do atrito, faz com que as pás das Hélices dos Geradores Eólicos girem mais rápido , gerando mais energia com o mesmo volume de vento.
column15: ESPINOSA JOSE ANTONIO ROMANO

column13: DEOSODORIZADOR DE BACIA SANITáRIA COM CAIXA DE áGUA ACOPLADA. Refere-se a presente invenção a um equipamento, movida a energia elétrica para aspirar os gases despejados na Bacia Sanitária durante a defecção, através dos furos e dutos de água próprios para a lavagem da Bacia Sanitária, e com o auxílio de uma nova válvula ar/água que permite direcionar os gazes rumo a um cjto. Exaustor/Filtrante e, também, direcionar a água, advinda da Caixa de água (acoplada á Bacia Sanitária), rumo à Bacia para efetuar sua lavagem, fechando o duto dos gazes, evitando a inundação do cjto. Exaustor Filtrante, salientando que os gazes despejados à Bacia Sanitária durante a defecção, são aspirados por forte motor elétrico e forçados a passar por um filtro de carvão ativado, similar ao já utilizado nos aparelhos de ar condicionado dos automóveis, para desta forma, remover os maus odores e devolver o ar, isento de cheiros repugnantes, ao próprio banheiro.

column12: MEJORAS A UN PROCEDIMIENTO PARA LA FABRICACION DE PLACAS REFLEJANTES, CON PELICULA RETRO-REFLECTIVA, PARA USARSE EN CIRCULACION E IDENTIFICACION DE VEHICULOS Y PRODUCTO RESULTANTE
column13: La presente invención se refiere a mejoras a un procedimiento para la fabricación de placas reflejantes, con película retro-reflectiva, para usarse en circulación e identificación de vehículos, caracterizado dicho procedimiento por los siguientes pasos: En primer término se pega la película retro-reflectiva a la lámina de la placa, enseguida se estampan los caracteres hacia el frente de la placa, después se pintan los carácteres con rodillos o cualquier otro elemento similar que haga el mismo efecto, para dejarlos cubiertos con una substancia tipo pintura que los cubra pero que no se le adhiera permanentemente a los caracteres y posteriormente, se pinta toda la placa con pistola de aire, aspersión o inmersión; después se quita o remueve la pintura de los carácteres, por lo que de esta forma quedan estos, con las características originales que les proporciona la película retro-reflectiva quedando el resto de la placa menos reflectiva, translúcida u opaco, logrando así un contraste que nos permite tener una mejor legibilidad de los carácteres de identificación de dicha placa.
column14: SIERRA ESPINOS JOSE LUIS DE LA
column15: ESPINOSA JOSE LUIS DE LA SIERR

column12: Method, system and apparatus for rejecting unauthorized or SPAM e-mail messages.
column13: A new method, system and apparatus of rejecting junk mail by using an access code that the sender inserts anywhere in the “SUBJECT” or “MESSAGE” sections of the e-mail message, and only those e-mail messages containing a valid access code either previously defined by the owner of the e-mail or dynamically generated for a particular e-mail address are delivered. Successful senders are then added in a list of approved senders, so they do not need to add the access code in future messages. The messages without a valid access code are returned to the sender with instructions to include the access code either in the SUBJECT or MESSAGE sections of the e-mail. If the access code is not known, the instructions request the sender to access an Internet page to respond to personal questions about the e-mail owner. Only those senders that can answer to at least one of these questions correctly obtain the access code. Alternative instructions are offered in the message returned to the sender to access a dynamically generated Internet contact-me form with the FROM, TO, SUBJECT and MESSAGE fields optionally pre-populated with the information of the original e-mail and optionally editable. After the sender submits the form, an e-mail is generated with this information and delivered to the recipient.

column12: Spectrophotometric apparatus with multiplex device and method using the apparatus
column13: The invention relates to a spectrophotometric apparatus fitted with a fibre-optic multiplex device including an incident radiation source (1), n forward optical fibres (2) leaving the source in a bundle (12) and each individually connected to one of the n measurement cells (3), and n return optical fibres (4), each starting from one of the n measurement cells, and extending to a photodetection zone (13) essentially consisting of the ends (14) of the n return optical fibres arranged in front of a photodetector (5) mounted on a motorised micrometer movement device (17) so that the photodetector is moved and is successively positioned facing each of the ends (14). The invention also relates to a method using the apparatus, preferably in near-infrared spectrophotometry, both as an analysis means and/or for on-line examination in a manufacturing process for chemical or biochemical petroleum products. <IMAGE>

column12: SISTEMA DE MULTIPLEXACION Y TRANSMISION DE SEÑALES ULTRASONICAS MEDIANTE FIBRA OPTICA.
column13: Sistema de Multiplexación y transmisión de señales ultrasónicas mediante fibra óptica. Procedimiento de multiplexación óptica y transmisión de las señales eléctricas generadas por los transductores piezoeléctricos, funcionando como receptores de ecos ultrasónicos, mediante la utilización de fibra óptica. Para la transmisión se utiliza la modulación en frecuencia de una subportadora, que a su vez modula la intensidad luminosa de la fuente óptica. Debido a esto, puede realizarse la multiplexación de varias señales procedentes de otros tantos sensores piezoeléctricos, y su transmisión sobre una única fibra para su posterior demultiplexión y estudio.

column12: Coated zinc, chemistry and manufacturing process
column13: A process for making coated zinc metal flakes, wherein finely divided zinc metal powder is dispersed and coated, using a high speed disperser, or the like, in the presence of a liquid dispersing and grinding vehicle, liquid or solid surfactants, and liquid or solid metal oxides. The dispersed coated zinc liquid mixture is then ground to flake form in a ball mill, or the like, filtered and dried, if is required in 100% solids, or left in paste form with a solid content as low as 40%. The liquid grinding vehicle may be hydrocarbon solvents, chlorinated solvents, glycols or liquid plasticizers, and may be used either alone or in combination. Another grinding agent, such as sodium or zinc stearate, may be used in the grinding vehicle for imparting leafing properties. Many different surfactants may be used, either along or combined. The coated materials selected among different metal oxides were: aluminum oxide, titanium dioxide, zirconium dioxide, chromium oxide, nickel oxide and silicon dioxide. The final product of this procedure is a zinc metal flake coated with a thin layer of a metal oxide, which may be either leafing or nonleafing, and in dry or paste form.

column12: System for multiplexing and transmitting ultrasonic signals by means of optical fibre
column13: System for multiplexing and transmitting ultrasonic signals by means of optical fibre. Process for optical multiplexing and transmission of the electrical signals generated by piezoelectric transducers functioning as ultrasonic-echo receivers, by means of the use of optical fibre. For transmission, frequency modulation of a subcarrier is used, the subcarrier in its turn modulating the brightness of the optical source. In this way, it is possible to achieve multiplexing of various signals originating from the same number of piezoelectric sensors, and the signals can be transmitted on a single fibre for subsequent demultiplexing and study.
column15: CURPIAN ALONSO JOSE;;MONTERO DE ESPINOSA FRANCISCO

column12: REVELADOR FOTOGRAFICO PARA AVANCE DE LA SENSIBILIDAD EFECTIVA EN PELICULAS CON EMULSION DE BLANCO Y NEGRO.
column13: Es un revelador fotográfico para películas con haluros de plata sensibles a la luz con emulsiones para blanco y negro capaz de aumentar su sensibilidad efectiva (descrito en ASA) entre un 300% y un 400% a partir de la sensibilidad nominal de éstas, dependiendo de la temperatura del color de las escenas a fotografiar. Los resultados se han calibrado por el Sistema de Zonas, basado en la traducción a grises de los colores de cualquier escena iluminada, y evaluadas densitométricamente obteniendo densidades de 0,3 (sobre base + velo) en zona III y de 1,2 para la zona VIII. El revelador objeto de la invención consigue sus resultados en el campo de la fotografía de laboratorio, particularmente en el revelado de las películas fotográficas. Asimismo permite aumentar la velocidad de obturación o reducir el diafragma en las tomas de fotografías, si fuese de interés, sin perjuicio en la calidad final de la imagen en el negativo. Los componentes de las diferentes estructuras del revelador objeto de lainvención son: Uno o dos agentes antioxidantes (Sulfito de sodio anhidro, y/o Borato de sodio (bórax)); uno o dos agentes aceleradores (Carbonato de sodio anhidro, y/o Hidróxido de sodio, y/o Carbonato de potasio, y/o Hidróxido de potasio); uno o dos agentes reveladores (Sulfato de pmetilaminofenol (Metol), y/o Hidroquinona, y/o Fenidona (1- Fenil-3-Pirazolidona); uno o dos agentes antivelo (Tiosulfato de pentaaqua sodio, y/o N-acetil p-aminofenol (Paracetamol)).

column12: Instant water heater by electromagnetic induction (Machine-translation by Google Translate, not legally binding)
column13: Instantaneous water heater by electromagnetic induction. The heater comprises an inductor coil (3) generating heat energy and able to induce currents of foucoult on a coil of ferromagnetic material (1), as the second element of the heater, whose coil circulates a fluid, namely water, for heating this one by means of the electromagnetic induction originated by the inductor coil (3). That is, the heat energy produced by the inductor coil (3) is transmitted to the water for heating thereof, through the transfer element that constitutes the coil (1), so that the temperature that can be reached will vary depending on the of the different parameters that need to be adjusted, such as the power of the inductor coil (3), the length of the coil (1), the mains water flow and the corresponding service pressure, with the inductor coil ( 3) and serpentine (1) are formal, dimensional and positionally coincident for maximum energy use and avoid heat loss. (Machine-translation by Google Translate, not legally binding)

column12: Power distribution system and method
column13: The power distribution system is releasably secured to the power distribution board and includes a circuit breaker to detect a fault condition and automatically move a circuit breaker switch from an on position to an off position. The power distribution system also includes a backplane connector for providing a connection to the power distribution board and an interconnection mechanism for connecting the circuit breaker to the backplane connector when the circuit breaker is moved relative to the backplane connector from the disengaged position to the engaged position. The power distribution system also includes a guard coupled to the interconnect mechanism and configured to cover a portion of the housing of the circuit breaker. The guard further prevents the circuit breaker switch from moving from the open position to the on position until the interconnect mechanism connects the circuit breaker to the backplane connector.
column15: PALACIOS RODRIGUEZ JOSE HECTOR;;ESPINOSA GUTIERREZ VICTOR DANIEL

column12: PRESSURE GAUGE PLUNGER FOR PLATFORMS FOR EXTRUSION-BASED 3D PRINTING OF SEMISOLID MASSES
column13: Disclosed is a pressure gauge plunger for 3D printing platforms, which can be used in various 3D printing fields (tissue bioprinting, food industry, pharmaceuticals, ceramics). The invention is useful in that it allows continuous control of the pressure applied during the entire printing process, owing to the use of the plunger. In this way, quality can be improved and errors can be detected in situ, it being possible to carry out corrective actions during the process. The amount of pressure exerted by the printing platform component on the plunger, and therefore on the mass to be extruded, is obtained by using a strain gauge. This continuous control allows the characterisation of the semisolid mass being printed, it being possible to set the most suitable printing parameters in situ, thus enabling the full automation of the process.

column12: IMAGING UNIT FOR VEHICLE
column13: To provide an imaging unit for vehicle capable of suppressing an optical axis of an imaging device accommodated inside from deviating even if an impact load is placed from outside.SOLUTION: An imaging unit comprises a rear imaging device 15 which images a circumference of a vehicle, a housing 19 which houses the rear imaging device 15 and is fitted to a side part of the vehicle, and a frame 50 which is fitted to the housing 19 while supporting the rear imaging device 15. The frame 50 comprises a camera fixing part 51 for fixing the rear imaging device 15, and is provided with a first elastic deformation part 52 whose front end is a free end abutting on the housing 19, and the first elastic deformation part 52 is extended from the camera fixing part, arranged on a side where an impact load F1 is input to the imaging unit 12 for vehicle, toward the housing 19.SELECTED DRAWING: Figure 7

column12: Bulletin board for contextual information sharing
column13: Embodiments relate to a bulletin board circuit (326) that stores contextual information received from various component circuits in an electronic device. The contextual information indicates an operating state of the corresponding component circuitry, system, or shared resource. When an event (e.g., turning on of the component circuitry) is detected, the stored contextual information may be retrieved by the one or more component circuitry. By using the bulletin board circuit, the component circuit can detect a change in the operating state of other component circuits, and can configure or update its operation even when a change occurs while the component circuit is sleep or disabled. The bulletin board circuitry may monitor updates of the contextual information through the component circuitry and initiate notifications to other component circuitry when certain entries of the contextual information are updated.
column15: O'SHEA HELENA DEIRDRE;;SAUER MICHAEL;;RIVERA ESPINOSA JOSE LUIS

column12: CONTROLADOR PARA ILUMINACION ESPECTACULAR CON TELEMANDO POR INFRARROJOS.
column13: Controlador para iluminación espectacular con telemando por infrarrojos. Consiste en un dispositivo utilizable durante el montaje luminotécnico de los espectáculos como consola de control auxiliar en las tareas de posicionamiento de los haces de luz de cada proyector. Esto permite el uso simultáneo de la consola central en labores más específicas, como la programación de escenas. El sistema (1) permite controlar, mediante un telemando (2) por infrarrojos (opcionalmente por cable), los niveles de trabajo hasta 99 canales de iluminación espectacular de cualquier dispositivo que acepte el protocolo estándar. El usuario puede seleccionar cualquier canal o grupo de canales, almacenarla y recuperarla cuando lo desee para una tarea concreta, o como luz auxiliar en pausas técnicas. En la unidad receptora (3), un grupo de leds indicará la operación realizada y cuatro displays de 7 segmentos muestran el último canal seleccionado y su nivel porcentual.
column15: GARCIA MOREDA MANUEL;;ESPINOSA ZAPATA FELIPE;;LAZARO GALILEA JOSE LUIS

column12: PROCEDIMIENTO CONSISTENTE EN LA UTILIZACION DE LOS GENES ATHAL3 DE ARABIDOPSIS THALIANA PARA LA OBTENCION DE PLANTAS CON CONTROL DEL DESARROLLO Y TOLERANTES AL ESTRES OSMOTICO Y SALINO.
column13: "Obtención de plantas con control del desarrollo y tolerantes al estrés osmótico y salino mediante manipulación genética de los genes Athal3 de Arabidopsis thaliana". Alteración del metabolismo del ciclo celular y la homehóstasis iónica de la planta, mediante la expresión de los genes Athal3 de Arabidopsis thaliana para conseguir plantas transgénicas con un control en su desarrollo y mayor tolerancia a estreses osmóticos ambientales como: sequía, salinidad y bajas temperaturas.
column15: ESPINOSA RUIZ ANA;;BELLES ALBERT JOSE M;;CULIANEZ MACIA FRANCISCO

column12: Show lighting controller with infrared remote control
column13: Show lighting controller with infrared remote control.It consists of a device that can be used during the technical light editing of shows as an auxiliary control console in the tasks of positioning the light beams of each projector. This allows the simultaneous use of the central console for more specific jobs, such as scene programming. The system (1) allows controlling, using an infrared (optional by cable) remote control (2), the work levels of up to 99 show lighting channels of any device that accepts the standard protocol. The user can select any channel or group of channels, store it, and recover it when desired for a specific task or as an auxiliary light during technical pauses. In the receiver unit (3) a group of leds will indicate the operation performed and four displays of 7 segments will show the last channel selected and its percentage level.<IMAGE>

column12: Process for producing hydrogenated rubbers

column12: Process for producing hydrogenated rubbers
column13: Process for producing hydrogenated rubbers which allows an easy and effective deactivation of the living polymer before hydrogenation step. The deactivation of living polymer is carried out using compounds with very good solubility in water of formula R-OH, R-COOH or compound of type R'n-Si-Cl4-n, R'n-Sn-Cl4-n, with n comprised between 0 and 3 extremes includ: wherein R is a C2-C20 alkyl group optionally containing one or more polar functional groups selected from C-OH, COOH and R' is a C1-C20 alkyl or C6-C20 aryl. The catalyst used in the hydrogenation of the deactivated polymer are titanocene compounds, being the most preferred those of formula Cp2Ti(PhOCH3)2 and Cp2Ti(CH2PPh2)2.

column12: Preparation of plants of enhanced e.g. salinity resistance comprises metabolism modification to enhance tolerance to ambient osmotic stress
column13: The preparation of plants of enhanced e.g. salinity resistance comprises changing the metabolism of the cell cycle and the ionic homeostasis of the plant by expression of the Athal 3 genes of Arabidopsis thaliana. The resulting transgenic plants are of controlled development, with better tolerance to ambient osmotic stress.

column12: AFFINITY AND FRIENDLINESS DETECTOR
column13: This invention relates to a system for establishing and/or developing human relations using wireless communications as a means of transporting information. One part (A), called the master device, communicates with other master devices of other users (A'), sharing what are known as profiles (P). These profiles are assessments that the system uses for comparison and that define or can define aspects of the user's personality, likes and concerns. The master devices (A, A', etc.) also communicate wirelessly (I, I', etc.) with specific or slave devices (B, B', etc.), with which they are associated and which they order to act in the manner programmed. The manner in which the slave devices (B, B', etc.) respond indicates the degree of affinity or friendliness between users.

column12: Coordinated operation of multiple communication chips via local hub device
column13: Embodiments relate to coordinating the operation of subsystems in a communication system of electronic devices, in which a coexistence hub device monitors status information transmitted as coexistence messages over one or more multipoint buses, processes the monitored coexistence messages, and sends control messages as coexistence messages to other systems on chip (SOC). The coexistence hub device may also update operation of the communication system. The coexistence hub device may receive the operational policies from the central processor and may execute the operational policies without further coordination of the central processor. The coexistence hub device broadcasts the control message as a coexistence message according to the executed operation policy.

column12: DIRECT DETECTION OF RESISTANCE MECHANISMS BY MALDI-TOF MASS SPECTROMETRY
column13: A method for direct detection of resistance mechanisms by MALDI-TOF Mass Spectrometry. The method comprises preparing different bacterial cultures and further using a double layer sinapinic acid technique for detection of intact protein, wherein each bacterial culture being contained in a MALDI target spot. The method also comprises acquiring a spectra of each culture by setting the spectrum range of a mass spectrometer using a MALDI-TOF software to a range comprised between 17,000 and 50,000 Da. Finally, the different acquired spectra are compared taking into account a theoretical weight of the protein to be detected.

column12: Ambulatory robot system
column13: An ambulatory robot system 10 comprises two robot units 11, 12 each provided with attaching means 14 for selectably attaching and detaching the respective unit 11, 12 from a surface (15a, 15b fig. 4A), a coupling linkage 13 composed of articulated limbs 16, 17 coupling the units 11, 12 together to be relatively movable for varying their positional relationship and drive means 19 for displacing the coupling linkage 13 to produce movement of either one of the units 11,12 in a direction of travel away from the other unit 11, 12 while one unit 11, 12 is detached from the surface (15a, 15b fig. 4A) and the other unit remains attached to the surface (15a, 15b fig. 4A). The units 11, 12 may comprises two relatively rotatable parts 11a, 11b and 12a, 12b. One end of the coupling linkage 13 may be provided with a functional component 20, the end being capable of being uncoupled from one of the units 11, 12. The attaching means 14 may be a plug or socket, magnetic fixing means or suction fixing means. The units 11, 12 may include traction means 21 move over a surface.

column12: Rear-view mirror assembly for motor vehicles
column13: It comprises a mirror base (200), a mirror housing (300) rotatable to the mirror base (200) between a non-driving retracted position and a driving protracted position around an axis (X), a non-metallic spring (400) for providing an axial spring force between the mirror base (200) and the mirror housing (300) whose force differs at least between the non-driving retracted and the driving protracted positions; and a first guide portion (350) for contacting a first contact area (450) of the non-metallic spring (400), and a second guide portion (250) for contacting a second contact area (460) of the non-metallic spring (400). The guide portions (350, 250) are configured such that, during rotation of the mirror housing (300) to the mirror base (200), at least one deformable portion (405) of the non-metallic spring (400) between the first and second contact areas (450, 460) is deformed in a direction (Y) substantially perpendicular to the mirror rotation axis (X).
column15: CABALLERO GUIRADO ADOLFO;;GOMEZ CASTILLA MIGUEL ANGEL;;ESPINOSA MORALES JOSE MANUEL

column12: REAR-VIEW MIRROR ASSEMBLY FOR MOTOR VEHICLES
column13: It comprises a mirror base (200), a mirror housing (300) rotatable to the mirror base (200) between a non-driving retracted position and a driving protracted position around an axis (X), a non-metallic spring (400) for providing an axial spring force between the mirror base (200) and the mirror housing (300) whose force differs at least between the non-driving retracted and the driving protracted positions; and a first guide portion (350) for contacting a first contact area (450) of the non-metallic spring (400), and a second guide portion (250) for contacting a second contact area (460) of the non-metallic spring (400). column12: REAR-VIEW MIRROR ASSEMBLY FOR MOTOR VEHICLE
column13: PROBLEM TO BE SOLVED: To provide a rear-view mirror assembly for a motor vehicle capable of achieving smoother operation of folding and unfolding the assembly, at a lower cost as compared with known rear-view mirror assemblies.SOLUTION: The rear-view mirror assembly for a motor vehicle comprises: a mirror base 200; a mirror housing 300 rotatable with respect to the mirror base between a non-driving retracted position and a driving protracted position around an axis X; a non-metallic spring 400 for providing an axial spring force between the mirror base and the mirror housing, whose force differs at least between the non-driving retracted and the driving protracted positions; and a first guide portion 350 for coming into contact with a first contact area 450 of the non-metallic spring, and a second guide portion 250 for coming into contact with a second contact area 460 of the non-metallic spring. The guide portions are configured so that, during rotation of the mirror housing with respect to the mirror base, at least one deformable portion 405 between the first and second contact areas of the non-metallic spring is deformed in a direction Y substantially perpendicular to the mirror rotation axis X.SELECTED DRAWING: Figure 1

column12: Ambulatory robot system
column13: An ambulatory robot system 10 comprises two robot units 11, 12 each provided with attaching means 14 for selectably attaching and detaching the respective unit 11, 12 from a surface (15a, 15b fig. 4A), a coupling linkage 13 composed of articulated limbs 16, 17 coupling the units 11, 12 together to be relatively movable for varying their positional relationship and drive means 19 for displacing the coupling linkage 13 to produce the relative movement when one unit 11, 12 is detached from the surface (15a, 15b fig. 4A) and the other unit remains attached to the surface (15a, 15b fig. 4A), the detached unit 11, 12 being rotatable relative to the attached unit 11, 12. The units 11, 12 may comprises two relatively rotatable parts 11a, 11b and 12a, 12b. One end of the coupling linkage 13 may be provided with a functional component 20, the end being capable of being uncoupled from one of the units 11, 12. The attaching means 14 may be a plug or socket, magnetic fixing means or suction fixing means. The units 11, 12 may include traction means 21 move over a surface.

column12: MULTI-PURPOSE MIXTURE FOR RUBBER FORMULATIONS

ASIMISMO, LA UTILIZACION DE ESTA COMPOSICION POSIBILITA UNA DISMINUCION DEL COSTO DE LA MEZCLA SIN AFECTAR LAS PROPIEDADES UTILES DE LAS MISMAS. ESPECIFICAMENTE CON LA INDUSTRIA DE LA GOMA Y SUS DERIVADOS. TIENE COMO OBJETIVO LA UTILIZACION DE LA LIGNINA MODIFICADA COMO COMPONENTE DE UNA\!

column12: Simulador basado en realidad virtual inmersiva para entrenamiento de procedimientos quirúrgicos
column13: La presente invención se relaciona con el campo del área de la salud y la educación. En particular, proporciona un sistema para realizar simulaciones de realidad virtual de múltiples cirugías para el entrenamiento de profesionales de la salud , que se caracteriza por que comprende: una interfaz mecánica incluida en una maleta, para facilitar su portabilidad que conecta a una pantalla para la simulación de un proceso de cirugía; dicha interfaz mecánica contiene dos manillas que simulan pinzas quirúrgicas para la inmersión de los sentidos del usuario; dicha interfaz mecánica contiene un sistema electrónico que se conecta operativamente con una pantalla para generar una interfaz visual; donde dicha interfaz visual contiene gráficas desarrolladas con ejercicios de motricidad; unas cámaras y unos sensores que aportan información sobre la posición y orientación de los movimientos del usuario en tiempo real, donde dichas cámaras se encuentran en un sistema de gafas de realidad virtual, y los sensores en las manillas; donde dichas cámaras y sensores se conectan operativamente a un software que permite generar una representación estereoscópica a partir de las imágenes tomadas por la cámara; y donde dicha interfaz visual cuenta con objetos tridimensionales de geometrías similares a objetos biológicos y quirúrgicos.

column12: BUOY FOR MOORING AND SUPPLYING SERVICES TO PLEASURE CRAFT
column13: A buoy for mooring and supplying services to pleasure craft includes: a body; a lower ring having a chain joined thereto, said chain terminating in an upper ring of a mooring post that rests on the seabed; an upper retractable mooring ring; and a removable satellite element, by means of which the craft is provided with drinking water hoses and electrical ducts that are joined to a branch duct of a distribution network, which extends from a connection cabinet located on land to the buoy. The ascending branch is joined by means of clamps to the mooring chain of same. The above-mentioned hoses and ducts and a steel safety cable can be wound around/unwound from a rotary drum housed inside the buoy. The buoy can be used at marinas, coves or similar locations to increase the number of mooring places available.

The invention can be used at marinas, coves or similar locations to increase the number of mooring places available.

column12: ELECTRICAL CONTACTOR AND ASSOCIATED CONTACTOR-CLOSURE CONTROL METHOD
column13: The invention relates to an electrical contactor and to the associated contactor-closure control method. The inventive electrical contactor (100) comprises: a removable conduction circuit (105), an actuator (110), a magnetic stator (115) and armature (120), and a controller (130). According to the invention, the actuator (110) is in mechanical communication with the removable conduction circuit (105), while the magnetic stator (115) and the magnetic armature (120) are disposed in field communication with one another and with an exciting coil (125) which responds to a coil current used to generate a magnetic field that is guided through the stator (115) and the armature (120). The above-mentioned controller (130) comprises a processing circuit (200) which is designed to control the coil current in response to the current and voltage in the coil (125), such that the coil current is controlled in response to the position and closure speed of the removable conduction circuit (105) before said circuit (105) closes as part of an open-to-closed movement.
column15: MORRON LLUCH RICARDO;;GARCIA ESPINOSA ANTONIO;;ALABERN MORERA XAVIER;;MUNOZ GALIAN JOSE

column12: CONTACTOR ELECTRICO Y PROCEDIMIENTO DE CONTROL DE CIERRE DE CONTACTOR ASOCIADO.
column13: Se describe un contactor (100) que tiene un circuito de conduccin separable (105), un impulsor (110), un inducido (120) y un esttor (115) magnético y un controlador (130). El impulsor (110) esá en comunicación mecánica con el circuito de conducción separabe (105), y el estator magnético (115) y el inducido magnético (10) están dispuestos en comunicación de campo entre sí y con una obina de excitación (125) que responde a una corriente de bobinaque sirve para generar un campo magnético dirigido a atravesar e estator (115) y el inducido (120). El controlador (130) tiene u circuito de procesamiento (200) adaptado para controlar la corrente de bobina en respuesta a la corriente y la tensión en la boina (125), de modo que la corriente de bobina se controla en resuesta a la posición y la velocidad de cierre del circuito de conucción separable (105) antes de que el circuito de conducción searable (105) se cierre durante una acción de movimiento de apertra a cierre
column15: MORRON LLUCH RICARDO;;GARCIA ESPINOSA ANTONIO;;ALABERN MORERA XAVIER;;MUNOZ GALIAN JOSE

column12: Process for producing hydrogenated rubbers
column13: Process for producing hydrogenated rubbers which allows an easy and effective deactivation of the living polymer before the hydrogenation step. The deactivation of living polymer is carried out using compounds with very good solubility in water of formula R--OH, R--COOH or compound of type R'.sub.n --Si--Cl.sub.4-n, R'.sub.n --Sn--Cl.sub.4-n, with n comprised between 0 and 3, extremes included; wherein R is a C.sub.2 -C.sub.20 alkyl group optionally containing one or more polar functional groups selected from C--OH, COOH, and R' is a C.sub.1 -C.sub.20 alkyl or C.sub.6 -C.sub.20 aryl. The catalysts used in the hydrogenation of the deactivated polymer are titanocene compounds, being the most preferred those of formula Cp.sub.2 Ti (PhOCH.sub.3).sub.2 and Cp.sub.2 Ti (CH.sub.2 PPh.sub.2).sub.2.

column12: Apparatus and method of controlling the closing action of a contactor
column13: A contactor having a separable conduction path, an actuator, a magnetic stator and armature, and a controller, is disclosed. The actuator is in mechanical communication with the separable conduction path, and the magnetic stator and magnetic armature are arranged in field communication with each other and with an excitation coil responsive to a coil current that serves to generate a magnetic field directed to traverse the stator and the armature. The controller has a processing circuit adapted to control the coil current in response to the current and voltage at the coil such that the coil current is controlled in response to the position and closing speed of the separable conduction path prior to the separable conduction path closing during an open-to-close action.
column15: LLUCH RICARDO MORRON;;ESPINOSA ANTONIO GARCIA;;MORERA XAVIER ALABERN;;GALIAN JOSE MUNOZ

column12: TELEMEDICINE SYSTEM FOR REMOTE CONSULTATION, DIAGNOSIS AND MEDICAL ASSISTANCE
column13: The invention relates to a telemedicine system including improved methods, systems and techniques for providing remote consultation, diagnosis and/or medical treatment. To this end, said system uses a Basic Telemedicine Unit BTU and a Specialist Telemedicine Unit STU comprising the simultaneous and independent display, on the local interface and on the remote interface, of all of the patient-related audio, video, biomedical data and clinical data signals, the concurrent annotation of images and videos, and processing for the protection of the personal data of the patients.

column12: Procedure for de-activating hydrogenated rubber, involves live polymer de-activated by highly soluble compounds in water with specific formula
column13: Procedure for producing hydrogenated rubber.Procedure for producing hydrogenated rubber, which provides easy, effective deactivation of the live polymer before hydrogenation. Deactivation of the live polymer is performed with highly water-soluble compounds of formula R-OH, R-COOH or with compounds such as R'n-Si-Cl4-n, R'n-Sn-Cl4- n, where n is between 0 and 3, inclusive of both,; where R is a C2- C20 alkyl group which may optionally contain one or more polar groups chosen between C-OH, COOH, and R' is a C1-C20 alkyl or is a C6-C20 aryl group.Hydrogenation of the polymers thus deactivated is performed with a titanocene type compound, with preference given to the compounds Cp2Ti(PhOCH3)2 and Cp2Ti(CH2PPh2)2.
column15: BARRIO CALLE JUAN ANTONIO;;PARELLADA FERRER M DOLORES;;ESPINOSA SORIANO M JOSE

column12: PROCEDIMIENTO PARA LA PRODUCCION DE CAUCHOS HIDROGENADOS.
column13: Procedimiento de producción de cauchos hidrogenados que permite una fácil y efectiva desactivación del polímero vivo antes de la hidrogenación. La desactivación del polímero vivo se realiza con compuestos de alta solubilidad en agua de fórmula R-OH, R-COOH ó con compuestos del tipo R''{sub,n}-Si-Cl{sub,4-n}, R''{sub,n}-Sn- Cl{sub,4-n} con n comprendido entre 0 y 3, ambos inclusive; donde R es un grupo alquilo C{sub,2}-C{sub,20} que puede contener opcionalmente uno o más grupos polares seleccionados de entre C- OH, COOH, y R'' es un grupo alquilo C{sub,1}-C{sub,20}o arilo C{sub,6}C{sub,20}. La hidrogenación de los polímeros así desactivados se realiza con un compuesto tipo titanoceno, siendo los más preferidos los compuestos Cp{sub,2}Ti(PhOCH{sub,3}){sub, 2} y Cp{sub,2}Ti(CH{sub,2}PPh{sub,2}){sub,2}.

column12: PROCESS FOR THE PRODUCTION OF HYDROGENATED RUBBERS.
column13: This invention refers to hydrogenated rubbers production procedure, which allows an easy and effective deactivation of living polymer before hydrogenation. Living polymer deactivation is carried out with high water-solubility compounds of formula R-OH; R-COOH or with compounds of the type R'n-Si-Cl4-n, R'n-Sn-Cl4-n, with n comprising between 0 and 3, both inclusive; wherein R is a C2-C20 alkyl group which may optionally contain one or more polar groups selected from between C-OH, COOH, and R' is a C1-C20 alkyl group or a C6-C20 aryl. Hydrogenation of polymers thus deactivated is carried out with a titanocene-type compound, the most preferred compounds being Cp2Ti(PhOCH3) and Cp2Ti(CH2PPh2).

column12: ELECTRICAL CONTACTOR AND ASSOCIATED CONTACTOR-CLOSURE CONTROL METHOD
column13: The invention relates to an electrical contactor and to the associated contactor-closure control method. The inventive electrical contactor (100) comprises: a removable conduction circuit (105), an actuator (110), a magnetic stator (115) and armature (120), and a controller (130). According to the invention, the actuator (110) is in mechanical communication with the removable conduction circuit (105), while the magnetic stator (115) and the magnetic armature (120) are disposed in field communication with one another and with an exciting coil (125) which responds to a coil current used to generate a magnetic field that is guided through the stator (115) and the armature (120). The above-mentioned controller (130) comprises a processing circuit (200) which is designed to control the coil current in response to the current and voltage in the coil (125), such that the coil current is controlled in response to the position and closure speed of the removable conduction circuit (105) before said circuit (105) closes as part of an open-to-closed movement.

column12: PROCESS FOR MANUFACTURING HYDROGENATED RUBBER
column13: The invention relates to a process for manufacturing hydrogenated rubber by the polymerisation of conjugated diene monomers According to the invention, the process comprises, in the first step, the polimerisation in solution of one or more monomers in the presence of lithium alkyde as a catalyst resulting in conjugated diene polymers and copolymers, and in the second step, the addition of a desactivation compound in a quantity at least equal to the quantity of polymerisation copolyser, having a ratio of water solubility/ hydrogenation solvent solubility higher than 49 and/or a boiling point higher than 110‹ C and, in the third stage, the hydrogenation of the deactivated polymer by adding a hydrogenation catalyst and the maintenance of the resulted mixture under hydrogen pressure in continuous, semi-continuous and batch manner system using stirred, tubular or loop reactors

column12: BUOY FOR MOORING AND SUPPLYING SERVICES TO PLEASURE CRAFT
column13: The invention relates to a buoy for mooring and supplying services to pleasure craft. The main elements of the invention comprise: a body a lower ring having a chain joined thereto, said chain terminating in an upper ring of a mooring post that rests on the seabed an upper retractable mooring ring and a removable satellite element, by means of which the craft is provided with drinking water hoses and electrical ducts that are joined to a branch duct of a distribution network, which extends from a connection cabinet located on land to the buoy. Said ascending branch is joined by means of clamps to the mooring chain of same. The above-mentioned hoses and ducts and a steel safety cable can be wound around/unwound from a rotary drum housed inside the buoy. The invention can be used at marinas, coves or similar locations to increase the number of mooring places available.

column12: PRESSURE GAUGE PLUNGER FOR PLATFORMS FOR EXTRUSION-BASED 3D PRINTING OF SEMISOLID MASSES
column13: The pressure gauge plunger for 3D printing platforms is applicable in various 3D printing fields (bioprinting of tissues; and the food, pharmaceutical, and ceramic industries). Its usefulness is rooted in its ability to continuously control the pressure applied during the entire printing process, thanks to the plunger mechanism. It thereby allows improved quality and detection of errors  in situ,  allowing corrective actions to be applied during the process. The pressure value that the printing platform component exercises on the plunger (and, thus, on the mass to be extruded) is obtained through use of a stress gauge, This continuous control allows profiling of the printed semi-solid mass, permitting the most appropriate printing parameters to be set  in situ,  further allowing the process to become completely automated.

column13: ''IMUNOGENE, SEQUêNCIA DE DNA, MOLéCULA RECOMBINANTE DE DNA, TRANSFORMANTE DE QUALQUER LINHAGEM CELULAR, PRODUTO DE EXPRESSãO, PROCEDIMENTO PARA A PRODUçãO DE ANTìGENOS BM95 NA LEVEDURA PICHIA PASTORIS, PPBMA DE DNA RECOMBINANTE, MICROORGANISMO TRANSFORMADO BMA-2, ANTìGENO, E, PREPARAçãO DE VACINA'' A presente invenção refere-se ao campo de Biotecnologia e Engenharia Genética, particularmente ao isolamento de um novo gene do carrapato do gado Boophilus microplus. Esta invenção também se refere a sua clonagem e expressão na levedura Pichia pastoris, à preparação de vacina que contém o antígeno em forma glicosilada e em partículas, assim como seu uso para o controle de infestações de carrapatos. Este novo antígeno é eficaz contra diferentes cepas de carrapatos, incluindo as contra as quais os antígenos similares não são.

column12: REVERSIBLE PRE-ASSEMBLED OVERLAPPING BAR LOCK INCLUDING AN INTERLOCKING SYSTEM FOR POSITIONING THE CYLINDER THEREIN
column13: The invention relates to the industry involved in the production of locks for securing and protecting goods, property, etc. More specifically, the invention relates to a pre-assembled overlapping lock intended to be installed in (right-hand or left-hand) wood and metal doors. The same lock can be correctly installed on the left- or right-hand side and can actuate the bolt from either side manually and/or with a coded key. No additional operations are required in order to replace an existing product with said new product. The invention's innovations include a luminous plastic knob which glows in the dark and, as such, enables the door or exit to be easily located in case of emergency. The invention is even more complex in that it clearly indicates the open and closed positions. The inventive lock is extremely advantageous in that it can be assembled without tools in a practical and quick manner owing to the interlocking system formed with the cover. Another notable aspect of production relates to the body of the cylinder formed by the body and cartridge, the practical assembly of which dispenses with the need for certain processes and saves time. Similarly, the interlocking system is formed by the catch which traps and secures the cylinder inside the body while the extension prevents the catch from rotating and releasing the cylinder. The inclusion of a braille system for the visually impaired and persons with special needs, who have hitherto been ignored, is completely revolutionary and represents both a social conscience and commercial vision. Finally, the aesthetic appearance of the lock provides added value and sets the product apart from the competition.

column12: SYSTEM AND METHOD FOR MEASURING A MASS OF FUEL WITHIN A VARIABLE GEOMETRY CONTAINER
column13: A system and method for measuring a mass of fuel contained in a variable geometry container. The container comprises a container assembly, formed by a variable geometry container disposed on a rigid support, a three-axis load cell coupled with the rigid support and providing a first set of three signals with a magnitude proportional to the force exerted by the container assembly, a three-axis accelerometer coupled with the rigid support and providing a second set of three signals with a magnitude proportional to the acceleration to which the container assembly is subjected, and a signal processing device configured to convert the first and the second set of signals into force and acceleration data, for three perpendicular directions of the space, and configured to calculate a measure relative to the mass of fuel contained in the variable geometry container.
column15: MARCOS MONTES JOSE LUIS;;ANGIBAUD GUILLAUME;;DE LA FUENTE LOPEZ SAMUEL;;ESPINOSA SANCHEZ MARTIN

column12: CAMERA MODULE FOR VEHICLE
column13: The invention relates to a camera module for attaching a camera to a motor vehicle. The camera module includes a camera unit (2) having an optical axis and a support (3) configured to receive a camera. The support (3) has a main positioning surface (10) transverse to the optical axis such that the front contact surface of the camera is in contact with the main positioning surface when the camera is mounted to the support (3). A cover (4) is attachable to the support (3) to hold the camera pressed against the support in a direction parallel to the optical axis. First pressure means (17, 17 ') are provided in the cover (4) and/or in the support (3) and are arranged such that, when the cover (4) is fastened to the support (3), the pressure means (17, 17') press the camera unit (2) against the support (3) in a direction parallel to the optical axis (X) and/or perpendicular to the main positioning surface (10).

column12: PROCESS FOR THE PRODUCTION OF A FORAGE ENRICHED IN PROTEIN FROM FERMENTATION IN SOLID STATE OF THE SUGAR CANE.
column13: El objetivo técnico de la invención es obtener un alimento con un 6-9% de proteína verdadera, que garantiza por si mismo un balance proteico adecuado en la alimentación animal. Para tal fin se utiliza un sustrato rico en carbohidratos fácilmente digerible como es la cana de azúcar natural finamente triturada, sin la esterilización del sustrato, bajos tiempos de retención y mínimos volúmenes de aire. Se establece una etapa preliminar de corte y molinado para disminuir el tamano de las partículas, estableciéndose algunos de los parámetros biotecnológicos que permiten el desarrollo del proceso con una productividad elevada. Este proceso se realiza considerando: el contenido de humedad inicial del medio fermentativo, el desarrollo de calor del proceso, la aereación, la altura de la cama formada por el sustrato, el requerimiento de cana fresca no estéril, el tamano de las partículas y la adición de sulfato de amonio y urea como fuentes de nitrógeno y de dihidrógeno fosfato de amonio como fuente de fósforo y nitrógeno.
column15: BLANCO GARCIA ARMANDO;;RODRIGUEZ JOSE ANTONIO;;ECHEVARRIA JACINTO N;;CONTRERAS ORESTES ROLANDO;;ESPINOSA MARIA ELENA

column12: NEWCASTLE DISEASE VIRUS AND THE USE THEREOF AS A VACCINE
column13: The present invention relates to new Newcastle viruses of any genotype and new fragments of the genome of the Newcastle disease virus that encode for the F and HN proteins - constructed through reverse genetics and recombination - of high antigenicity for the preparation of vaccines for the prevention of Newcastle disease by reducing viral excretion or for the use thereof as vectors with other viruses in a lyophilized form or emulsified in oil. Likewise, it can be used as a vector in combination with other pathogenic agents.

column12: Latching detection and indication system for aerial refueling couplings
column13: Reception coupling unit (31) of a hose and drogue device (19, 21) of a tanker aircraft (13) with the probe (25) of a receiver aircraft (11) for in-flight refueling, comprising, respectively, first and second cooperating latching means (39, 29) that can be positioned in one or more latching states in a refueling operation, in which the reception coupling unit (31) comprises at least a detector (51, 71) of said latching states and at least a first indication means (55, 75) and/or a second indication means (65) for providing, respectively, to the pilot of the receiver aircraft (11) and/or to the crew of the tanker aircraft (13) indications that said cooperating latching means (39, 29) are positioned in one or more of said latching states, said detector (51, 71) being operatively connected, respectively, to a first indication means (55, 75) and/or to a second indication means (65).

column12: DEVICE RESTRICTING AND FILTERING NASAL VENTILATORY FLOW
column13: Device restricting and filtering nasal ventilatory flow for filtering and restricting inspiratory flow. It comprises a strip of hypoallergenic cloth which may have differing porosity obstructing the ventilatory flow to a greater or lesser extent, a strip of hypoallergenic fabric to prevent the passage of mites, pollen and contaminant substances wherein may be incorporated substances of a pharmacological or deodorising nature, an adhesive strip for the retention thereof in the nose, and a plastic strip to protect the system until the utilisation thereof by the subject. The device may be utilised for restricting and filtering the air inhaled by individuals in daily life or during physical training. The employment thereof during physical training improves the physical capacity, strength and stamina of the muscles responsible for the inhalation part of the respiratory process.

column12: SHEET FOR CLOSING ASEPTIC CONTAINERS, ASEPTIC CONTAINER COMPRISING SAID SHEET, AND EQUIPMENT AND METHOD FOR OBTAINING SAID CONTAINER.
column13: Sheet for closing aseptic containers, aseptic container comprising said sheet, and equipment and method for obtaining said container. The closing sheet comprises a first sheet (7), which is configured to have ethylene oxide pass through it, and a second sheet (8) made from impermeable material. The first sheet (7) is obtained from a first reel (7') of film made from material that is permeable to ethylene oxide, and the second sheet (8) is obtained from a second reel (8') of film made from impermeable material. The first sheet (7) is longitudinally sealed to the second sheet (8) by means of a sealing line (18), thus forming a single closing sheet (10).

column12: Superalloy mortar tube
column13: A finless mortar tube made of a superalloy includes, seriatim, a breech end, a beginning taper point, an ending taper point, a lower clamp region, an upper clamp region, and a muzzle end. The nominal wall thickness of the tube is constant from forward of the breech end to the beginning taper point and the nominal wall thickness of the tube decreases from the beginning taper point to the ending taper point. The mortar tube is capable of a substantial increase in the rate of fire compared to conventional mortar tubes.

column12: Sheet for closing aseptic containers, aseptic container comprising said sheet, and equipment and method for obtaining said container
column13: The present invention relates to a closing sheet for aseptic containers, aseptic container comprising said sheet, equipment and method for obtaining said container. The closing sheet comprises a first sheet ( 7 ) configured to be traversed by ethylene oxide and a second sheet ( 8 ) of impermeable material. The first sheet ( 7 ) is obtained from a first reel ( 7′ ) of film of material that is permeable to ethylene oxide and the second sheet ( 8 ) is obtained from a second reel ( 8′ ) of film of impermeable material. The first sheet ( 7 ) is longitudinally sealed to the second sheet ( 8 ) through a sealing line ( 18 ), thus forming a single closing sheet ( 10 ).

column12: METHOD AND SYSTEM OF DETECTING OBSTACLE ELEMENTS WITH A VISUAL AID DEVICE
column13: A method and system for detecting obstacle elements is presented in the present disclosure, the detection performed with a visual aid device, the device comprising a distance sensor, the sensor being mounted in a wearable device to be worn by a user. Several embodiments of the detection method and system allow the further detection of different types of obstacles, in order to map and signal them to a user with low-vision.

column12: FLUID-EJECTION DEVICE
column13: The fluid-ejection device (100) comprises a first member (110) and a second member (120). The second member (120) is movable relative to the first member (110) and has an outlet (125) from which fluid can be discharged. The first member (110) has a first inlet (200) adapted to be fed by fluid from a source of fluid (250), and is connected to the outlet (125), and a second inlet (300) adapted to be fed by fluid from a source of fluid (250) that is capable of driving the second member (120) so as to move it relative to the first member (110).

column12: SUPERALLOY MORTAR TUBE
column13: A finless mortar tube is made of a superalloy. The superalloy is based on one of cobalt, iron and nickel. The finless mortar tube has an integrally formed blast attenuation device. The mortar tube may be 60, 81 or 120 mm. The mortar tube is capable of a substantial increase in the rate of fire compared to conventional mortar tubes.

column12: Fluid-ejection device
column13: The invention relates to a fluid-ejection device. The fluid-ejection device (100) comprises a first member (110) and a second member (120). The second member (120) is movable relative to the first member (110) and has an outlet (125) from which fluid can be discharged. The first member (110) has a first inlet (200) adapted to be fed by fluid from a source of fluid (250), and is connected to the outlet (125), and a second inlet (300) adapted to be fed by fluid from a source of fluid (250) that is capable of driving the second member (120) so as to move it relative to the first member (110).

column12: SYSTEM AND METHOD FOR SELECTING A SYSTEM OF ELEVATORS
column13: The invention relates to a system for selecting a system of elevators, including at least one elevator, to be installed in a building. The system comprises: means for obtaining data relating to the building; means for generating at least one user request model from the building data; means for obtaining a set of data for each elevator in the elevator system; control means which simulate the operation of the elevator system according to the sets of data for the elevators in the elevator system and the generated user request model and which determine the result of the simulation of said system during same; means for executing the aforementioned control means; and means for displaying the result of the simulation for each elevator system considered.

column12: METHOD AND PHOTONIC CRYSTAL FOR THE SPATIAL FILTERING OF AN ELECTROMAGNETIC RADIATION BEAM, AND ELECTROMAGNETIC RADIATION SOURCE COMPRISING SAID PHOTONIC CRYSTAL
column13: The invention relates to a method for the spatial filtering of an electromagnetic radiation beam, according to which an electromagnetic radiation beam is projected onto a photonic crystal (1) and propagated through said photonic crystal (1). The invention also describes the characteristics of the photonic crystal (1) for the spatial filtering of an electromagnetic radiation beam outside the photonic crystal (1) in such a way that the longitudinal spatial period and the transversal spatial period of a face of said photonic crystal (1) depend on the wavelength of the electromagnetic radiation beam to be filtered. The invention further relates to an electromagnetic radiation source (2) comprising said photonic crystal (1).

column12: FLUID INJECTOR
column13: PROBLEM TO BE SOLVED: To provide a fluid injector which achieves high cost-effectiveness in manufacturing as well as having a simple structure.SOLUTION: A fluid injector (100) includes a first member (110) and a second member (120). The second member (120) can move relative to the first member (110) and has an outlet (125) through which the fluid can be discharged. The first member includes a first inlet (200) adapted to be supplied with the fluid from a fluid source and includes a second inlet (300) which is connected with the outlet (125) and adapted to be supplied with the fluid from the fluid source. The fluid source drives the second member (120) and moves the second member relative to the first member.SELECTED DRAWING: Figure 6

column12: METHOD AND PHOTONIC CRYSTAL FOR THE SPATIAL FILTERING OF AN ELECTROMAGNETIC RADIATION BEAM, AND ELECTROMAGNETIC RADIATION SOURCE COMPRISING SAID PHOTONIC CRYSTAL
column13: The invention relates to a method for the spatial filtering of an electromagnetic radiation beam, according to which an electromagnetic radiation beam is projected onto a photonic crystal (1) and propagated through said photonic crystal (1). The invention also describes the characteristics of the photonic crystal (1) for the spatial filtering of an electromagnetic radiation beam outside the photonic crystal (1) in such a way that the longitudinal spatial period and the transversal spatial period of a face of said photonic crystal (1) depend on the wavelength of the electromagnetic radiation beam to be filtered. The invention further relates to an electromagnetic radiation source (2) comprising said photonic crystal (1).

column12: DEVICE RESTRICTING AND FILTERING NASAL VENTILATORY FLOW
column13: Device restricting and filtering nasal ventilatory flow for filtering and restricting inspiratory flow. It comprises a strip of hypoallergenic cloth which may have differing porosity obstructing the ventilatory flow to a greater or lesser extent, a strip of hypoallergenic fabric to prevent the passage of mites, pollen and contaminant substances wherein may be incorporated substances of a pharmacological or deodorising nature, an adhesive strip for the retention thereof in the nose, and a plastic strip to protect the system until the utilisation thereof by the subject. The device may be utilised for restricting and filtering the air inhaled by individuals in daily life or during physical training. The employment thereof during physical training improves the physical capacity, strength and stamina of the muscles responsible for the inhalation part of the respiratory process.

column12: SYSTEM AND METHOD FOR CATALOGING COINS
column13: The invention relates to a system and method for cataloging coins, said system comprising: coin conveying means for conveying deposited coins to image-capture means that are used to capture and record images of the obverse and reverse of each coin conveyed by the conveying means; processing means for obtaining and recording at least one discriminatory parameter for each coin; coin labelling means for labelling coins; and recording means for recording the pre-stored comparison information and the information generated for each coin, in which at least one coin discriminatory parameter consists of the degree of difference between the obverse and reverse of each coin based on the images captured by the image capture means.

column12: Wearable device for supply of percutaneous articles
column13: The invention comprises a head (3) with an outer cavity (6), which resonates and accommodates two ultrasonic resonators (resonator 1, resonator 2). A first resonator (1) located further distally emits towards the skin at a first frequency, and a second resonator (2) located further proximally emits around the outer cavity (6) and parallel to the skin at a second frequency. Wherein one frequency is a high frequency ultrasound introduction (HFS) and the other is a low frequency ultrasound introduction (LFS). The second resonator (2) comprises an inner through-hole (7) to enable the passage of waves from the first resonator (1). Waves from the second resonator (2) pass through the head (3), the inner through-hole (7) and the outer cavity (6), bounce off and interfere with waves from the first resonator (1) in the opposite area of the head (3). Interference between waves creates a static field that increases skin-a-skin permeability, enabling reduced size devices to be incorporated into wearable devices.

column13: Bearing diagnostic equipment. Diagnostic method for bearings applied to induction motors by means of common mode currents and device for the start-up of said method. column12: SISTEMA Y PROCEDIMIENTO PARA SELECCIONAR UN SISTEMA DE ASCENSORES.
column13: Sistema y procedimiento para seleccionar un sistema de ascensores. El sistema para seleccionar un sistema de ascensores, que comprende al menos un ascensor, a aplicar en un edificio, comprende medios para obtener datos referentes al edificio; medios para generar al menos un patrón de demandas de usuario a partir de los datos del edificio; medios para obtener un conjunto de datos para cada ascensor del sistema de ascensores; medios de control que simulan el funcionamiento del sistema de ascensores dependiendo de los conjuntos de datos de los ascensores del sistema de ascensores y del patrón de demandas de usuario generado, y determinan el resultado de la simulación de dicho sistema de ascensores durante la misma; medios para ejecutar dichos medios de control; y medios para mostrar el resultado de la simulación para cada sistema de ascensores considerado.

column12: NUTRACEUTICAL ENCAPSULATED BY MICRO FLUIDIZATION WITH ANTI-INFLAMMATORY AND PREBIOTIC EFFECT.
column13: The present invention refers to a nutraceutical encapsulated by micro fluidization with an anti-inflammatory and prebiotic effect, which includes: fatty oil contained in minimally processed fish eyes, which has a high concentration of: i. eicosapantenoic acid (EPA). ii. Decosahexaenoic acid (DHA). The eicosapantenoic acid (EPA) and the decosahexaenoic acid (DHA) are encapsulated by micro fluidization by colloids and a material with probiotic effects that do not inhibit the function of said acids (DHA/EPA) and allow the prebiotic bacteria to grow for improving the digestion. The nutraceutical encapsulated by micro fluidization with anti-inflammatory and prebiotic effect may be applied in food, supplements and complements. The nutraceutical encapsulated by micro fluidization with anti-inflammatory and prebiotic effect may inhibit the cyclooxygenase 2 enzyme (COX-2), involved in the inflammatory process, and reduces the plantar edema induced by carrageenan in mice.

column12: IMMOBILIZED REDOX MEDIATORS FOR THE TREATMENT OF CONTAMINATED WATERS AND GAS EMISSIONS
column13: The present invention relates to a treatment process applicable to degrade or transform organic and inorganic pollutants, commonly found in industrial wastewaters, contaminated aquifers and gas emissions, in which reduction or oxidation reactions (e.g. redox reactions) are involved. The treatment concept comprises reactors in which catalysts, with redox mediating properties, have been immobilized on ion exchange resins in order to improve and accelerate the transformation of priority pollutants by chemical or biological means.

column12: Method and fault diagnostic equipment in alternate current electric motors. (Machine-translation by Google Translate, not legally binding)
column13: Method and equipment to diagnose faults in electric motors of alternating current. This new method and equipment supposes a more generic alternative and of lower computational cost to the systems or classics for the diagnosis of motors as they are the analysis of currents or of vibrations by means of the classic spectral analysis, which introduce errors in case of non-stationary conditions. It consists of a new fault diagnosis system in ac electric motors based on the current measurement, using the wavenes agnesi function to define easily tunable filter banks that allow the temporal study of the different fault characteristics, and its later processed. The aforementioned processing is based on the analysis of the energy component of each of these previously tuned bands and the establishment of the failure factor (f). (Machine-translation by Google Translate, not legally binding)

column12: SYSTEM AND METHOD FOR SELECTING A SYSTEM OF ELEVATORS
column13: The invention relates to a system for selecting a system of elevators, including at least one elevator, to be installed in a building. column12: IMPROVEMENTS IN THE DESIGN OF THE ABSORBENT CORE IN DIAPERS FOR NEWBORN BABIES
column13: The invention relates to an absorbent matrix to be used in a nappy for newborn babies, which has a front part, a rear part and a crotch part, such that the crotch part has a maximum width of 5 cm in order to allow the legs of the baby to form a maximum angle "a" of 30° to the vertical. Said matrix also comprises a base weight of between 700 and 900 g/m2, a density which varies between 0.16 and 0.24 g/cm3,and a ratio of absorbent material / superabsorbent material of 50/50 and 70/30.

column12: UNA TELA NO TEJIDA UTILIZADA COMO CAPA DE TRANSFERENCIA EN ARTICULOS ABSORBENTES DESECHABLES, UN ARTICULO ABSORBENTE DESECHABLE QUE INCORPORA DICHA CAPA DE TRANSFERENCIA Y UN PROCESO PARA FABRICAR DICHA CAPA.
column13: Una tela tejida utilizada como capa de transferencia en artículos absorbentes desechables, un artículo absorbente desechable que incorpora dicha capa de transferencia y un proceso para fabricar dicha capa, siendo los artículos tales como panales desechables para bebés, panales desechables para adultos incontinentes, calzones entrenadores o toallas femeninas, que mejora notablemente las características de la matriz absorbente de dichos artículos, sobre todo después de la primera descarga. La capa de transferencia de la presente invencion es una tela no tejida que está formada por una mezcla de al menos dos tipos de fibras sintéticas unidas por calor, mezcladas y procesadas de tal manera que se obtienen las características deseadas en cuanto a distribucion, tiempo de penetracion e hidrofilicidad después de varias descargas de líquidos. El proceso para fabricar la capa de transferencia consiste en pre-mezclar dos o más tipos de fibras sintéticas tales como poliéster y polipropileno, o cualquier otro tipo de fibras sintéticas adecuada para este fin, alimentarlas a un abridor donde se abren las fibras y se mezclan homogéneamente; esta mezcla es alimentada a la o las cardas respectivas, antes de entrar a las mismas se forman la o las napas de las que se obtienen velos de fibras, por ultimo pasan por una calandra que une las fibras mediante calor. Cuando esta película es usada como capa de transferencia en artículos absorbentes desechables, se obtienen mejoras de alrededor de 30 a 50% en cuanto a permeabilidad al líquido y retorno del líquido a la superficie después de varias descargas.

column12: Continuous prepn. of prods. from thermoplastic-elastic material
column13: Process comprises dispersing and homogenising the components under combined effect of heat, pressure, and a mechanical element. Crosslinking being brought about by the crosslinking agent (I). Homogeneous mass is led continuously through interior of a heating zone where it is subjected to effect of temp. and a mechanical element which exerts its transposing and homogenising effect for a suitable time interval, the mass flowing through being already in the crosslinked state. Without interruption, the mass is conveyed to a shaping zone by means of the mechanical element and at a temp. suitable for prepn. of a thermoplastic material. The prod. is cooled and opt. granulated or produced as a continuous element. Prod. can be elastic film, e.g. for coating of roofs, or tubes, etc.. Method is more advantageously commercially and technically (thermoplasticity, elasticity, mechanical resistance of prod.) than one in which compsn. is extruded continuously and prod. then crosslinked by heating in an oven.

column12: PEPTIDE-BASED ASSAY TO DIFFERENTIATE ANIMALS INFECTED WITH CSFV FROM VACCINATED ANIMALS
column13: The present patent application discloses a dendrimeric peptide construct and method to differentiate animals infected with the Classical Swine Fever Virus (CSFV) from animals vaccinated with the CSFV FlagT4G vaccine. The method disclosed herein comprises conducting two immunoassays, preferably ELISAs, to differentiate infected from vaccinated animals (DIVA); one immunoassay to detect humoral response against the dendrimeric peptide of the invention and a second immunoassay to detect humoral response against the E2 glycoprotein of the CSFV. Accordingly, the presently disclosed method allows the differentiation of three groups of individuals: animals vaccinated with FlagT4G vaccine, animals infected with CSFV and animals that are neither infected nor vaccinated.

column12: Non woven permeability controller for eg. disposable nappies consists of eg. polyester and polypropylene fibres bonded to regulate liquid penetration
column13: The non-woven permeability controller for eg. disposable nappies comprises a hot-bonded synthetic fibres product regulating the liquid penetration volume and rate. Also claimed is a process for fabricating the controller. CLAIMED - The process feeds a mixture of eg. polyester and polypropylene fibres to a homogenizer and to carder brushes before a hot bonding calender. EMBODIMENT - Permeability is increased 30 to 50 %.

column12: IMMOBILISED REDOX MEDIATORS FOR TREATMENT OF CONTAMINATED WATER AND GAS EMISSIONS
column13: The present invention relates to a treatment process applicable for degrading or converting organic and inorganic contaminants, commonly found in industrial waste waters, contaminated aquifers and gas emissions, wherein reduction or oxidation reactions (e.g. redox reactions) are involved. The treatment concept comprises reactors wherein catalysts, with properties mediated by redox, have been immobilised in ion exchange resins to improve and accelerate the conversion of priority contaminants through chemical or biological means.
