column12: CAPA DE TRANSFERENCIA PARA ARTICULOS ABSORBENTES DESECHABLES Y PROCESO PARA SU FABRICACION.
column13: Capa de transferencia para artículos absorbentes desechables y proceso para su fabricación. Capa de transferencia usada en pañales desechables para bebés y adultos, compresas, etc., que mejora notablemente las características de la matriz absorbente de dichos artículos, sobre todo después de la primera descarga. Es una tela no tejida formada por una mezcla de al menos dos tipos de fibras sintéticas unidas por calor, mezcladas y procesadas de modo que se obtienen las características deseadas de distribución, tiempo de penetración e hidrofilicidad después de varias descargas de líquidos. El proceso de fabricación consiste en premezclar dos o más tipos de fibras sintéticas como poliéster y polipropileno, alimentarlas a un abridor donde se abren y se mezclan. La mezcla pasa por las cardas, pero antes se forman napas de las que se obtienen velos de fibras. Por último pasan por una calandra que une las fibras mediante calor. Esta película se usa como napa de transferencia en artículos absorbentesdesechables, obteniéndose grandes mejoras.

column12: SYSTEM AND METHOD FOR CLEANING A VEHICLE-MOUNTED SENSOR
column13: An aspect of the invention refers to a system for cleaning an external vehicle-mounted sensor surface. The system comprises an air nozzle arranged to discharge air onto a sensor surface; an air pump comprising a fluid inlet, an air outlet, an air-fluid interface and a variable volume compression chamber communicated with the air outlet; an air flow control device communicated with the air nozzle and the air outlet for controlling the flow of air therethrough; and a liquid pump communicated with the fluid inlet to supply a flow of pressurized liquid such that the volume of the compression chamber varies to generate a volume of pressurized air with an absolute pressure below 10 bar.

column12: PROCESS FOR THE SUPERFICIAL HARDENING IN STEELS BY MEANS OF A BORON-NITRIDING THERMOCHEMICAL TREATMENT IN POWDER, PERFORMED IN TWO STAGES.
column13: The present invention refers to a process for the superficial hardening in steels by means of a boron-nitriding thermochemical treatment in powder, performed in two stages. The superficial hardening process of the present invention describes the construction of stainless steel AISI 304 metallic containers where the samples subjected to the treatment are introduced, also describing the selection of the steels to be exposed to the thermochemical treatment, the preparation of the powder including boron carbide for carrying out the first stage of the treatment, the preparation of the mixture including calcium cyanamide powder and the silicate compound for performing the second stage of the thermochemical treatment, the process finishing with the inspection and the physic-chemical and mechanical characterisation of the boron-nitriding layers formed onto the surface of the hardened steels. The process for the superficial hardening of steels by means of a thermochemical treatment of boron-ni triding in powder performed in two stages generates the presence of a system of Fe4N, FeB and Fe2B layers for increasing the mechanical, physical and chemical properties over the surface of different steels exposed to this treatment. The boron-nitriding layers are highly resistant to abrasion, erosion, corrosion and present a suitable adherence over the steel since the hardness in the material surface is substantially increased. The thickness of the boron-nitriding layers depends on the temperatures of the process, the times of the treatment and the chemical composition of the steel. The invention also refers to the application of the different steels subjected to this thermochemical treatment.

column12: Process for the continuous production of products from partly or completely crosslinked thermoplastic-elastic material
column13: The invention relates to a process for the continuous production of products from partly or completely crosslinked thermoplastic-elastic material, starting with a mixture of components containing a crosslinking agent, in which process the components are dispersed and homogenised by a combined effect of temperature, pressure and a mechanical element, as a result of which a crosslinking is brought about with the aid of the abovementioned agent. The process is distinguished in that the crosslinkable homogeneous compound is continuously guided through the interior of a heating zone, where it is subjected to the effect of temperature, and to a mechanical element that effects its translation and homogenisation over an appropriate duration, the compound flowing through being already in the crosslinked state and passing into the shaping region without interruption with the aid of the same mechanical element and under a temperature adjusted to produce a thermoplastic material, which is followed by a cooling and, if required, granulation or the production of a continuous element.

column12: PROCESO PARA OBTENER UNA TELA NO TEJIDA CON ZONAS DE PERMEABILIDAD
column13: Un método para convertir una tela no tejida hidrofóbica en una tela no tejida con una zona central hidrofílica y dos zonas laterales hidrofóbicas, caracterizado porque después de aplicar mediante espreado un líquido zonificador que torna hidrofílica la zona central, se aplica también mediante espreado un líquido anti-rozaduras con propiedades emolientes y de cuidado de la piel. Un método para convertir una tela no tejida hidrofóbica en una tela no tejida con una zona central hidrofílica y dos zonas laterales hidrofóbicas, caracterizado porque antes de aplicar mediante espreado el líquido zonificador que torna hidrofílica la zona central, se aplica también mediante espreado un líquido anti-rozaduras con propiedades emolientes y de cuidado de la piel. Un método para fabricar una tela no tejida, tal como el descrito en las reivindicaciones 1 y 2, caracterizado porque el líquido zonificador es soluble en agua. Un método para fabricar una tela no tejida, tal como el descrito en las reivindicaciones 1 a 3, caracterizado porque la zona central hidrofílica de la tela no tejida mantiene esta propiedad después de múltiples descargas. Un método para fabricar una tela no tejida, tal como el descrito en las reivindicaciones 1 a 4, caracterizado porque el líquido anti-rozaduras es insoluble en agua.

column12: OPTICAL MICROMESH FOR COMPUTERIZED DEVICES
column13: Multiple camera systems which use laser illumination for ranging benefit from a heartbeat to synchronize the timing of the individual lasers to eliminate collisions of multiple simultaneous laser emissions. An optical micromesh system provides for the dynamic entry and egress of mobile and stationary nodes. The optical communication between nodes may be controlled using time domain multiplexing (TDM) to avoid cross talk and communication collision due to overlapping laser illumination. By using an optical, laser based micromesh network, laser ranging can be used to dynamically map node location.

column12: COOKED MEAT FOOD PRODUCT WITH LOW CONTENT IN SATURATED FAT AND PROCEDURE FOR PREPARATION THEREOF
column13: The present invention relates to a cooked meat product which includes a quantity of saturated fat less than 0.5% wt, preferably, gluten-free despite the product being cooked ham of pig or cooked loin of pig, and its preparation procedure which includes selecting a meat raw material, and treating said meat raw material with a formulation of ingredients and spices, optionally without common salt or sodium chloride, and preferably also without gluten sources.

column12: OPTICAL MICROMESH FOR COMPUTERIZED DEVICES
column13: Multiple camera systems which use laser illumination for ranging benefit from a heartbeat to synchronize the timing of the individual lasers to eliminate collisions of multiple simultaneous laser emissions. An optical micromesh system provides for the dynamic entry and egress of mobile and stationary nodes. The optical communication between nodes may be controlled using time domain multiplexing (TDM) to avoid cross talk and communication collision due to overlapping laser illumination. By using an optical, laser based micromesh network, laser ranging can be used to dynamically map node location.

column12: Using pattern recognition to reduce noise in a 3D map
column13: To reduce the random noise in a depth map that is rendered using colors to convey the various depths, pattern recognition may be used to selectively apply noise reduction or to modulate the strength of the noise reduction. In this way, the potential adverse effect on the detail/sharpness of the image can be ameliorated. For example, in an image of a person, the skin does not have any sharp edges so noise reduction can be applied to such an image with little adverse consequence, whereas noise reduction applied to the image of a person's eye can cause loss of the detail of the iris, eyelashes, etc. Using pattern recognition on objects in the image, the appropriate level of noise reduction can be applied across an image while minimizing blurring/loss of detail.

column12: Fabrication of non woven cloth with permeability zones consists of conversion of hydrophobic material by local spraying and skin care liquid application
column13: The fabrication of non-woven cloth with permeability zones comprises conversion of hydrophobic material, by zonal spraying with liquid generating permeability. The cloth is also treated with softening and skin-care liquid.

column12: CAPA DE TRANSFERENCIA PARA ARTÌCULOS ABSORBENTES DESECHABLES
column13: Se describe una capa de transferencia y un proceso para su fabricación, para ser usada en artículos absorbentes desechables, tales como pañales desechables para bebés, pañales desechables para adultos incontinentes, calzones entrenadores o toallas femeninas, que mejora notablemente las características de la matriz absorbente de dichos artículos, sobre todo después de la primera descarga.

column12: Using multiple cameras to stitch a consolidated 3D depth map
column13: Each of plural devices includes a laser emitter and a camera for detecting reflections of laser light emitted by the device, so that plural of the devices can generate their own depth maps showing images within the field of view of their cameras. The resulting 3D depth maps from multiple cameras at potentially arbitrary locations can be aggregated to create a more accurate 3D depth map of the area covered by all the individual cameras. Each device/camera may be assigned a unique identification such as a unique number and a mechanism to identify, either electronically or visually, devices in its field of view. Using this information, the relative locations of the cameras can be calculated for purposes of aggregating the multiple depth maps.

column12: USING MULTIPLE CAMERAS TO STITCH A CONSOLIDATED 3D DEPTH MAP
column13: Each of plural devices includes a laser emitter and a camera for detecting reflections of laser light emitted by the device, so that plural of the devices can generate their own depth maps showing images within the field of view of their cameras. The resulting 3D depth maps from multiple cameras at potentially arbitrary locations can be aggregated to create a more accurate 3D depth map of the area covered by all the individual cameras. Each device/camera may be assigned a unique identification such as a unique number and a mechanism to identify, either electronically or visually, devices in its field of view. Using this information, the relative locations of the cameras can be calculated for purposes of aggregating the multiple depth maps.

column12: Using super imposition to render a 3D depth map
column13: Each of plural devices includes a laser emitter and a camera for detecting reflections of laser light emitted by the device, so that plural of the devices can generate their own depth maps showing images within the field of view of their cameras. The resolution of each depth map may be improved by accessing a data store of prior images of objects and combining the prior images using super-resolution with current images of the depth maps.

column12: COLOR NOISE REDUCTION IN 3D DEPTH MAP
column13: A camera based depth mapping system. Depth information is coded with colors to make a laser-generated 3D depth map easier to interpret. In the event that the laser illumination is not sufficient, the depth information can have a low signal to noise ratio, i.e., the depth map can be noisy. Color noise reduction techniques are used to alleviate this problem.
column14: SONY CORP;;SONY INTERACTIVE ENTERTAINMENT INC;;SHINTANI PETER
column15: SHINTANI PETER;;GONZALEZ HERNANDEZ JOSE OMAR;;CLAY WILLIAM;;ESPINOSA PABLO ANTONIO;;ANSFIELD FRED;;MOHAPATRA BIBHUDENDU;;RESCH KEITH;;USAMI MORIO
column32: NATHAN SILBERMAN ET AL: "Indoor scene segmentation using a structured light sensor", COMPUTER VISION WORKSHOPS (ICCV WORKSHOPS), 2011 IEEE INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON, IEEE, 6 November 2011 (2011-11-06), pages 601 - 608, XP032095295, ISBN: 978-1-4673-0062-9, DOI: 10.1109/ICCVW.2011.6130298

column12: USING PATTERN RECOGNITION TO REDUCE NOISE IN A 3D MAP
column13: To reduce the random noise in a depth map that is rendered using colors to convey the various depths, pattern recognition may be used to selectively apply noise reduction or to modulate the strength of the noise reduction. In this way, the potential adverse effect on the detail/sharpness of the image can be ameliorated. For example, in an image of a person, the skin does not have any sharp edges so noise reduction can be applied to such an image with little adverse consequence, whereas noise reduction applied to the image of a person's eye can cause loss of the detail of the iris, eyelashes, etc. Using pattern recognition on objects in the image, the appropriate level of noise reduction can be applied across an image while minimizing blurring/loss of detail.

column12: Method of detector of occupation of railway circuits, and corresponding device (Machine-translation by Google Translate, not legally binding)
column13: Detection method of occupation of railway track circuits, and corresponding device. Each point between track sections (1) has an emitter (4, 5, 6) and a receiver (8, 9, 10), thus giving a double sensorization of the occupation of the track section (1) by the train, in which fdma and cdma techniques can be used. Each end of track section (1) has track separation elements (2) and tuned passive coupling elements (3) of emitters and receivers. Each emitter injects into the track a unique digital code that modulates a frequency carrier f1 or f2, alternating these frequencies in successive transmitters of the track and propagating the code in both directions of the track. The receivers also alternate their tuning frequencies between f1 and f2 but so that their frequency does not coincide with that of the emitter of the same point on the track. (Machine-translation by Google Translate, not legally binding)
column15: MARQUEZ VARELA VICENTE;;MAZO QUINTAS MANUEL;;URENA URENA JESUS;;HERNANDEZ ALONSO ALVARO;;JIMENEZ CALVO JOSE ATONIO;;ESPINOSA ZAPATA FELIPE

column12: USING MULTIPLE CAMERAS TO STITCH A CONSOLIDATED 3D DEPTH MAP
column13: Each of plural devices includes a laser emitter and a camera for detecting reflections of laser light emitted by the device, so that plural of the devices can generate their own depth maps showing images within the field of view of their cameras. The resulting 3D depth maps from multiple cameras at potentially arbitrary locations can be aggregated to create a more accurate 3D depth map of the area covered by all the individual cameras. Each device/camera may be assigned a unique identification such as a unique number and a mechanism to identify, either electronically or visually, devices in its field of view. Using this information, the relative locations of the cameras can be calculated for purposes of aggregating the multiple depth maps.
column15: SHINTANI PETER;;GONZALEZ HERNANDEZ JOSE OMAR;;CLAY WILLIAM;;ESPINOSA PABLO ANTONIO;;ANSFIELD FRED;;MOHAPATRA BIBHUDENDU;;RESCH KEITH;;USAMI MORIO

column12: USING MICRO MIRRORS TO IMPROVE THE FIELD OF VIEW OF A 3D DEPTH MAP
column13: A micro mirror assembly widens the field of view (FOV) of a 3D depth map sensor, alleviating the limitation of limited laser illumination power and limitations on the resolution of the available imaging device.

column12: PROCESO PARA OBTENER UNA TELA NO TEJIDA CON ZONAS DE PERMEABILIDAD
column13: Proceso para obtener una tela no tejida con zonas de permeabilidad. La presente invención se refiere a un método para convertir una tela no tejida hidrófoba en una tela no tejida con una zona central hidrófila y dos zonas laterales hidrófobas, aplicando mediante rociado un líquido zonificador que torna hidrófila la zona central. Además, a la tela se le aplica un líquido antirrozaduras con propiedades emolientes y de cuidado de la piel. Se describe también la tela no tejida resultante.

column12: Color noise reduction in 3D depth map
column13: A camera based depth mapping system. Depth information is coded with colors to make a laser-generated 3D depth map easier to interpret. In the event that the laser illumination is not sufficient, the depth information can have a low signal to noise ratio, i.e., the depth map can be noisy. Color noise reduction techniques are used to alleviate this problem.

column12: NON-ANCHORING PEDAL VALVE.
column13: Described and claimed is a non-anchoring pedal valve for controlling the discharge of water in toilets, which has all the elements to be self-supported, so that does not require fastening elements to be attached to furniture or floor. This is achieved by integrating the opening and closing control mechanism of the valve to the base where the foot is supported for exerting pressure over the opening and closing mechanism of the valve. The mechanism for controlling the flow is based on a shank which moved by the direct action of the pedal may recover the closing position by the action of elastic elements when the pressure exerted over the pedal is released. The valve includes the elements required for avoiding the leak of working fluid.

column12: Optical micromesh for computerized devices
column13: Multiple camera systems which use laser illumination for ranging benefit from a heartbeat to synchronize the timing of the individual lasers to eliminate collisions of multiple simultaneous laser emissions. An optical micromesh system provides for the dynamic entry and egress of mobile and stationary nodes. The optical communication between nodes may be controlled using time domain multiplexing (TDM) to avoid cross talk and communication collision due to overlapping laser illumination. By using an optical, laser based micromesh network, laser ranging can be used to dynamically map node location.

column12: USING MICRO MIRRORS TO IMPROVE THE FIELD OF VIEW OF A 3D DEPTH MAP
column13: A micro mirror assembly widens the field of view (FOV) of a 3D depth map sensor, alleviating the limitation of limited laser illumination power and limitations on the resolution of the available imaging device.

column12: USING SUPER IMPOSITION TO RENDER A 3D DEPTH MAP
column13: Each of plural devices includes a laser emitter and a camera for detecting reflections of laser light emitted by the device, so that plural of the devices can generate their own depth maps showing images within the field of view of their cameras. The resolution of each depth map may be improved by accessing a data store of prior images of objects and combining the prior images using super-resolution with current images of the depth maps.

column12: Sobrasada and pate of sobrasada under grease and its obtaining procedure. (Machine-translation by Google Translate, not legally binding)
column13: Sobrasada and low-fat sobrasada pate and its obtaining procedure. The present invention relates to a sobrasada or light sobrasada pate that has a fat content of approximately half that of a traditional sobrassada paste. Additionally, it is a product that provides approximately 50% less calories, in addition to having a reduced content of saturated fats and cholesterol with respect to products of traditional composition. On the other hand, the present invention also relates to the process for obtaining said sobrasada or sobrasada pate. (Machine-translation by Google Translate, not legally binding)

column12: COLOR NOISE REDUCTION IN 3D DEPTH MAP
column13: A camera based depth mapping system. Depth information is coded with colors to make a laser-generated 3D depth map easier to interpret. In the event that the laser illumination is not sufficient, the depth information can have a low signal to noise ratio, i.e., the depth map can be noisy. Color noise reduction techniques are used to alleviate this problem.

column12: PROCESO PARA FABRICAR UNA CAPA DE TRANSFERENCIA PARA ARTICULOS ABOSRBENTES DESECHABLES
column13: Se refiere a un proceso para fabricar una capa de transferencia para ser usada en artículos absorbentes desechables para adultos incontinentes, calzones entrenadores, pañales desechables para bebes o toallas femeninas, que mejora notablemente las características de penetración y retorno de líquidos del artículo absorbente. El proceso consiste en pre mezclar dos o más tipos de fibras sintética adecuada para este fin, alimentarlas a un abridor donde se abren las fibras y se mezclan homogeneamente.

column12: DYNAMIC CONTROLLER AND METHOD FOR THE FUZZY CONTROL OF AN ELEVATOR GROUP, FOR OPTIMISING THE ENERGY CONSUMPTION
column13: The invention relates to a method for the fuzzy control of an elevator group, for optimising the energy consumption, of the type used by systems for controlling vertical transport elevators, characterised in that it comprises steps of evaluating the energy aptitude of each car and assigning the floor calls in a certain order according to (i) a first absolute energy assessment (1) (ii) a second relative energy assessment (5) and (iii) a third assessment according to the contiguity (8) of the calls.

column12: Wearable Device for Transdermal Product Supply
column13: A wearable device for transdermal product supply comprises a head, which houses two ultrasonic resonators in resonance, with an outer cavity. A first, more distal resonator emits towards the skin at a first frequency and a second, more proximal resonator surrounds the cavity and emits parallel to the skin at a second frequency. One frequency is high-frequency sonophoresis (HFS) and the other is low-frequency sonophoresis (LFS). The second resonator comprises a hole in order to enable the waves from the first resonator to pass through. The waves from the second resonator pass through the head, the hole and the cavity, bouncing off an opposite area of the head and interfering with the waves from the first resonator. The interference between the waves creates a stationary field which increases the permeability of the skin, enabling a device with a reduced size to be incorporated into a wearable.

column12: PROCESO PARA OBTENER UNA TELA NO TEJIDA CON ZONAS DE PERMEABILIDAD
column13: El presente se refiere a un método para convertir una tela no tejida hidrofóbica en una tela no tejida con una zona central hidrofílica y dos zonas laterales hidofóbicas, aplicando mediante espreado un líquido zonificador que torna hidrofílica la zona central; se aplica a la misma además un líquido anti-rozaduras con propiedades emolientes y de cuidado de la piel. Se describe también la tela no tejida resultante.

column12: LONG-LIFE COOKED MEAT PRODUCT
column13: The invention relates to a method for producing a stuffed, cooked meat product, comprising: (a) mixing a meat mass at a concentration of between 85% and 98 wt.-% with a mixture comprising at least one protein having a high emulsifying capacity and at least one stabilising hydrocolloid, at a concentration of between 5 and 12 wt.-% of the total mixture (b) stuffing the mixture into non-aluminised, high-strength, multi-layer plastic casings (c) subjecting the stuffed mixture to a high-temperature and high-pressure autoclave cooking process and (d) cooling the mixture using a stream of cold water. The invention also relates to the meat product that can be produced using the aforementioned process.

column12: 경피 제품 공급을 위한 웨어러블 장치
column13: 본 발명은 경피 제품 공급을 위한 웨어러블 장치에 관한 것으로, 외부 공동(6)을 갖는, 공진 시에 2개의 초음파 공진기(1,2)를 수용하는 헤드(3)를 포함한다. 제1의 더 원위의 공진기(1)는 제1 주파수에서 피부를 향해 방출하고 제2의 더 근위의 공진기(2)는 공동(6)을 둘러싸고 제2 주파수에서 피부에 평행하게 방출한다. 하나의 주파수는 고주파 소노포레시스(high-frequency sonophoresis, HFS)이고 다른 하나는 저주파 소노포레시스(low-frequency sonophoresis, LFS)이다. 제2 공진기(2)는 제1 공진기(1)로부터의 파(wave)가 통과할 수 있도록 구멍(7)을 포함한다. 제2 공진기(2)로부터의 파는 헤드(3), 홀(7) 및 공동(6)을 통과하여, 헤드(3)의 대향 영역에서 바운싱되고 제1 공진기(1)로부터의 파와 간섭한다. 파들 사이의 간섭은 피부의 투과성을 증가시키는 고정 필드를 생성하여, 감소된 크기의 장치가 웨어러블 내에 통합될 수 있게 한다.

column12: Production of heterologous protein in a minimal culture medium
column13: The process to produce heterologous proteins in a minimal culture medium consists of (i) transforming a bacterial strain that is secretary in a minimal culture medium with a plasmid that contains the coding sequence of said heterologous protein, (ii) culturing said strain in a minimal culture medium, and (iii) recovering the heterologous protein. The bacterial strain that is secretary in a minimal culture medium can be obtained by means of a process that comprises (a) transforming bacteria adapted to grow in a minimal culture medium with a plasmid that comprises a DNA sequence that encodes for a protein that is toxic for a bacteria when it accumulates in the cytoplasm and whose synthesis is coupled to the secretion into the periplasm, (b) culturing said transformed bacteria in a minimal culture medium, and (c) selecting the surviving bacteria. It is applicable in the production of proteins of interest in bacteria that are secretary in a minimal culture medium.

column12: WEARABLE DEVICE FOR TRANSDERMAL PRODUCT SUPPLY
column13: The invention relates to a wearable device for transdermal product supply, comprising a head (3) which houses two ultrasonic resonators (1,2) in resonance and has an outer cavity (6). A first, more distal resonator (1) emits towards the skin at a first frequency and a second, more proximal resonator (2) surrounds the cavity (6) and emits parallel to the skin at a second frequency. One frequency is high-frequency sonophoresis (HFS) and the other is low-frequency sonophoresis (LFS). The second resonator (2) comprises a hole (7) for the passage of the waves from the first resonator (1). The waves from the second resonator (2) pass through the head (3), the hole (7) and the cavity (6), bouncing off an opposite area of the head (3) and interfering with the waves from the first resonator (1). The interference between the waves creates a stationary field which increases the permeability of the skin, enabling a device with a reduced size to be incorporated into a wearable.

column12: Measurement system with rogowski probe without integrator (Machine-translation by Google Translate, not legally binding)
column13: System measured with rogowski probe without integrator. The present invention consists of a new measuring system for the detection of faults in electric motors of alternating current based on the measurement of currents by rogowki probe without integrator. The use of the rogowski coil and integrator circuit as has traditionally been used for the measurement of low frequency currents presents problems. For the analysis of low frequency current harmonics used in the diagnosis of electric motors, the signal provided by the rogowski probe without integrator is valid. (Machine-translation by Google Translate, not legally binding)

column12: DYNAMIC CONTROLLER FOR DETECTING TRAFFIC PATTERNS BY MEANS OF FUZZY LOGIC
column13: The invention relates to a method, a device and a dynamic control system for detecting traffic patterns (UPPEAK, DOWNPEAK, LUNCHPEAK, INTERFLOOR) by means of fuzzy logic wherein, according to the value of mass variables and mass variations, a fuzzy inference process is carried out on the basis of the mass component, the variation of said mass, and the type of immediately preceding traffic, thereby determining, according to the evaluation of the inference rules and the weight of said components, the type of traffic pattern corresponding to the period of time in question.

column12: Mirror device for motor vehicles
column13: A mirror device for motor vehicles comprises an outer housing (40) with a cover (10) having a (PVD) coating; a lens (20); and illumination means (30, 31) such as LEDs, light guides, light emitting surfaces and/or blinkers. The lens (20) has a first area (21) internal to the cover (10), and a second transparent area (22) extending to one side of the outer housing (40). The cover (10) has a first cover element (11) external to the lens (20) and of a nature such that the illumination means (30, 31) are visible from the exterior when they are on and not visible from the exterior when they are off. The cover has a substantially opaque second cover element (12) having an overlapping portion between the first area (21) of the lens (20) and the first cover element (11).

column12: SYSTEM FOR DIAGNOSING DEFECTS IN ELECTRIC MOTORS.
column13: The invention relates to a device for the diagnosis of flanges in tri-phase motors. More specifically, the invention relates to a device comprising means for the inductive aquisition of currents in a common mode for the simple and practical diagnosis of the defects in the flanges of a tri-phase motor. The invention also relates to a current-measuring device comprising means for capturing currents by inductive methods. The invention further relates to a device and a method for detecting defects in alternating-current electric motors, and more specifically, to a device and a method for obtaining parameters relating to the possible defects in an electric motor, in order to carry out a reliable diagnosis of the defects during the normal operation of the motor.

column12: MIRROR DEVICE FOR MOTOR VEHICLES
column13: It comprises an outer housing (40) with a cover (10) having a (PVD) coating; a lens (20); and illumination means (30, 31) such as LEDs, light guides, light emitting surfaces and/or blinkers. The lens (20) has a first area (21) internal to the cover (10), and a second, transparent area (22) extending to one side of the outer housing (40). The cover (10) has a first cover element (11) external to the lens (20) and of a nature such that the illumination means (30, 31) are visible from the exterior when they are on and not visible from the exterior when they are off. The cover has a substantially opaque second cover element (12) having an overlapping portion between the first area (21) of the lens (20) and the first cover element (11).

column12: DYNAMIC CONTROLLER FOR DETECTING TRAFFIC PATTERNS BY MEANS OF FUZZY LOGIC
column13: The invention relates to a method, a device and a dynamic control system for detecting traffic patterns (UPPEAK, DOWNPEAK, LUNCHPEAK, INTERFLOOR) by means of fuzzy logic wherein, according to the value of mass variables and mass variations, a fuzzy inference process is carried out on the basis of the mass component, the variation of said mass, and the type of immediately preceding traffic, thereby determining, according to the evaluation of the inference rules and the weight of said components, the type of traffic pattern corresponding to the period of time in question.

column12: SYSTEM FOR DIAGNOSING DEFECTS IN ELECTRIC MOTORS
column13: The invention relates to a device for the diagnosis of flanges in tri-phase motors. More specifically, the invention relates to a device comprising means for the inductive aquisition of currents in a common mode for the simple and practical diagnosis of the defects in the flanges of a tri-phase motor. The invention also relates to a current-measuring device comprising means for capturing currents by inductive methods. The invention further relates to a device and a method for detecting defects in alternating-current electric motors, and more specifically, to a device and a method for obtaining parameters relating to the possible defects in an electric motor, in order to carry out a reliable diagnosis of the defects during the normal operation of the motor.
column15: CUSIDO I ROURA JORDI;;ROMERAL MARTINEZ JOSE LUIS;;ORTEGA REDONDO JUAN ANTONIO;;GARCIA ESPINOSA ANTONIO;;DELGADO PRIETO MIGUEL;;PONCELAS LOPEZ OSCAR

column12: DYNAMIC CONTROLLER AND METHOD FOR THE FUZZY CONTROL OF AN ELEVATOR GROUP, FOR OPTIMISING THE ENERGY CONSUMPTION
column13: The invention relates to a method for the fuzzy control of an elevator group, for optimising the energy consumption, of the type used by systems for controlling vertical transport elevators, characterised in that it comprises steps of evaluating the energy aptitude of each car and assigning the floor calls in a certain order according to (i) a first absolute energy assessment (1); (ii) a second relative energy assessment (5); and (iii) a third assessment according to the contiguity (8) of the calls.

column12: COOKED MEAT FOOD PRODUCT WITH LOW CONTENT IN SATURATED FAT AND PROCEDURE FOR PREPARATION THEREOF
column13: The present invention relates to a cooked meat product which includes a quantity of saturated fat less than 0.5% wt, preferably, gluten-free despite the product being cooked ham of pig or cooked loin of pig, and its preparation procedure which includes selecting a meat raw material, and treating said meat raw material with a formulation of ingredients and spices, optionally without common salt or sodium chloride, and preferably also without gluten sources.

column12: SISTEMA DE EXTRACCION DE JUGO DE LA CANA DE AZUCAR Y EL EQUIPAMIENTO PARA LOGRARLO
column13: Sistema de extracción de jugo de la cana de azúcar donde intervienen equipos para la preparación inicial de la cana, cuchillas picadoras tradicionales, así como desmenuzadora, desfibradora, conductor de lavado y molinos de dos, tres o más mazas, caracterizado porque la preparación inicial se completa mediante el uso de una desfibradora alimentada a presión por una desmenuzadora mediante un conducto cerrado cuyas paredes superiores e inferiores poseen en sus extremos unos dientes que penetran en el perfil de las mazas de la desmenuzadora, a continuación de la desfibradora se ubica un molino de 3,4 ó 6 mazas que alimenta a un conductor de lavado de 9 a 10m de longitud formado por 3 módulos de difusión a contracorriente, llevando cada uno alimentación de jugo de maceración y artesas que recogen el jugo percolado a través del colchón de bagazo, posterior al conductor se dispone un molino lavador de 2 mazas seguido de un conjunto de molinos secadores también de 2 mazas previos a un molino de 3 ó más mazas.

column12: METHOD FOR PRODUCING FOOTWEAR WITH A CONTROLLED INTERNAL TEMPERATURE
column13: The invention relates to a method for producing footwear with a controlled internal temperature, comprising the application of microcapsules containing phase change materials to footwear components, such as middle soles, soles, insoles or lining, and the application of a preferably aqueous adhesive. For components such as soles, insoles and middle soles, the microcapsules are applied first, followed by the adhesive. In the case of a lining component, a mixture of the adhesive and the microcapsules is applied. In both cases, the adhesive is applied using an air gun, with pressures of 0.5 to 10 bar, preferably 0.5 to 2 bar. A footwear item is obtained, such as a shoe or a boot, with components that provide thermal comfort while maintaining the internal temperature at around 32 C.

column12: POLYMERIZATION OF POLYETHYLEN TEREPHTHALATE AND THE POLYMERIC NANOCOMPOUNDS THEREOF BY MICROWAVES.
column13: The present invention refers to a novel process for producing polyethylene terephthalate (PET) and the nanocompounds thereof by the application of microwaves radiation, in a closed and unimodal reaction system, using the ethylene glycol and terephthalic acid monomers. The microwave radiation is performed in a constant manner at 200W for the first three minutes of the reaction time. The process of the present invention consists in a single step of the batch type.

column12: processo de sìntese de poli(álcool vinilico) e/ou poli(acetato de vinila) com morfologia esférica e estrutura casca-núcleo e seu uso na embolização vascular
column13: "PROCESSO DE SìNTESE DE POLI(áLCOOL VINILICO) E/OU POLI(ACETATO DE VINILA) COM MORFOLOGIA ESFéRICA E ESTRUTURA CASCA-NúCLEO E SEU USO NA EMBOLIZAçãO VASCULAR". A presente invenção descreve um processo de sintese de partículas esféricas de poli (álcool vinílico)PVA e/ou poli(acetato de vinila)- PVAC com estrutura casca núcleo a partir da hidrólise total ou parcial em meio aquoso cáustico, com obtenção de partículas de PVA / PVAc com morfologia esférica controlada, a serem utilizadas em embolização vascular.

column12: APARATO PORTATIL PARA LA MEDICION DE LA CONDUCTIVIDAD TERMICA DE SOLIDOS
column13: Se refiere a un aparato portatil para la medicion de la conductividad termica de los materiales solidos que comprende una placa fria y una placa caliente entre las que se encuentra dispuesta una muestra debidamente aisladas, sensores de temperatura conectados a la placa caliente y a la placa, transductores de flujo de calor Qc acoplado termicamente entre la muestra y las placas caliente y frias, un calentador conectado a la placa caliente, una celda Peltier conectada la placa fria y una unidad de control conectada a los transductores de flujo de calor QF y Qc. a los sensores de temperatura, al calentador y a la celda Peltier y, una unidad de enfriamiento acoplado sobre la celda Peltier conectada a la unidad de control. El aparato de esta invencion es de facil traslado, completamente automatizado permitiendo realizar una adecuada medicion de la conductividad termica con su respectiva in situ y ademas proporciona un medio de enfriamiento eficiente para reducir el tiempo para la estabilizacion termica.

column12: NEW URACIL DERIVATIVES HAVING AN ANTI-TUMOUR ACTIVITY AND RELATED COMPOUNDS (N-1 DERIVATIVES OF 5-SUBSTITUTED-URACILE

column12: FLOW-MEASUREMENT ULTRASONIC DEVICE APPLIED IN FIELD AND METHOD FOR DETERMINING THE TRANSIT TIMES.

column12: Method for producing a hydrogen-detection sensor, and resulting sensor
column13: The invention relates to a method for producing a visual hydrogen sensor and to a sensor produced in this manner, said sensor allowing the presence of hydrogen gas in a medium to be detected by the naked eye as a result of a change of colour in the sensor. The method involves the deposition of thin porous layers of oxides that do not absorb visible light in their completely oxidised state and which become coloured when they are partially reduced. The deposition step is carried out using vapour phase deposition (VPD) in a glancing angle configuration (GLAD). The method also involves: the preparation of a solution of an active metal precursor, capable of dissociating the hydrogen molecule, and a carrier; and the deposition of said solution on the oxide layer in order to incorporate a minimum quantity of active metal within the pores of the oxide layer in the form of nanoparticles.

column12: Pendulum device for low energy impact testing (Machine-translation by Google Translate, not legally binding)
column13: Pendulum device for testing low energy impacts of the type used to perform characterizations of materials by the charpy method, characterized by having a control system that prevents recoil or rebound and greater damage than desired on the material. The device is compact and versatile and can be attached to different tools in horizontal, vertical or inclined, achieving impacts in any direction. It consists of a bed (1) and wings (2) on which both the axis of rotation (3) and the calipers (4) of the brake, an arm (6) that has through holes (10) and a mass (7) that slides through the arm (6) and is fixed on it, and finally an interchangeable impactor (11) that is screwed into the mass (7). The advanced control system commands a pneumatic brake that has a pushbutton to release it and an angle transducer (12) to activate it again when it detects the overshoot of a certain level or the change of angle of the mass (7). (Machine-translation by Google Translate, not legally binding)

column12: System and method of gas analysis present in the interanular space of solar tube receivers (Machine-translation by Google Translate, not legally binding)
column13: System and method of analysis of the gas present in the inter-cellular space of solar tube receivers. The present invention relates to a method and non-invasive system for evaluating the vacuum state and detecting the type of gas existing in the inter-cellular cavity of receiver tubes (1) present in parabolic trough collectors. The method comprises the ignition of a plasma in the inter-cellular cavity of said receiver tube (1), and the subsequent evaluation of the spectrum emitted by the excited plasma by means of an optical analysis subsystem. The system of the invention also comprises a radio frequency source (2), an impedance coupler (3) and a radiofrequency applicator (4) by means of which radiofrequency energy is applied on the outer cover (1 ") of tube glass (1). The optical analysis subsystem is equipped with a spectrometer (7) which, connected to a computer (10), performs the analysis of the spectrum of the gas present in the receiver tube (1). (Machine-translation by Google Translate, not legally binding)

column12: Device for determining the inertia tensors and the positions of the centres of gravity in three dimensions
column13: The device has a set of position encoders (12) allowed to cooperate with one of a set of altitude sensors (5). The sensors are charged to measure position of a set of elements supported by a set of guides (11) with regard to an axis of measurement of a set of inertial tensors (E) of a structure. The inertial tensors are utilized to provide position, speed, angular acceleration and torque of a motor (16). The inertial tensors of the structure are determined with regard to vertical axis of measurement of the inertial tensors.

column12: Device for determining the inertia tensors and the positions of the centres of gravity in three dimensions
column13: Dispositif servant à mesurer les centres de gravité et les tenseurs d'inertie d'une structure dans les trois dimensions spatiales avec un seul amarrage de la structure au dispositif, facilement ré-ajustable par l'utilisateur. Ce dispositif se compose fondamentalement d'un mécanisme d'élévation (10) avec deux axes de rotation, permettant de positionner la structure (0) à mesurer dans toutes les orientations nécessaires ; un automatisme induisant un mouvement rotationnel dans le troisième axe de rotation du dispositif, composé par un moteur (16), un système de contrôle et d'acquisition (20) et des capteurs (18) et (19) et deux capteurs (3) et (19) facilement remplaçables, dont la position est ajustable. L'application de ce dispositif est de préférence le calcul du tenseur d'inertie et la position de centre de gravité d'une structure, en trois dimensions.

column12: Method for producing an organic solvent-free lycopene concentrate the resulting concentrate and composition comprising said concentrate
column13: The procedure concerns placing into contact a lycopene source with a supercritical fluid under conditions that permit the solubilisation of lycopene in this supercritical fluid and to separate the lycopene concentrate by depressurisation of the supercritical fluid loaded with lycopene. When the depressurisation is carried out at pressures below 10 MPa, an oleoresin is obtained and when it is performed at pressures above this an extract is obtained, both of which are rich in lycopene free of organic solvents. The concentrate and the compositions it comprises have antioxidant properties and are useful for elaborating food products, cosmetics and pharmaceutical and nutraceutical products.

column12: METHOD FOR PRODUCING AN ORGANIC SOLVENT-FREE LYCOPENE CONCENTRATE, THE RESULTING CONCENTRATE AND COMPOSITION COMPRISING SAID CONCENTRATE
column13: The method involves contacting a source of lycopene with a supercritical fluid under conditions enabling solubilization of the lycopene in said supercritical fluid and separating the lycopene concentrate by depressurizing the supercritical fluid charged with lycopene. An oleoresin is obtained when depressurization is carried out to pressures lower than 10 MP and an extract is obtained when it is performed at higher pressures, both the oleoresin and the extract being rich in organic solvent-free lycopene. The concentrate and the compositions comprised therein have antioxidant properties and are useful for the preparation of food, cosmetic, pharmaceutical or nutraceutical products.

column12: PROCEDURE POUR LA PRODUCTION D'UN CONCENTRE DE LYCOPENE LIBRE DE DISSOLVANTS ORGANIQUES, CONCENTRE OBTENU ET COMPOSITION QUI COMPREND LE DIT CONCENTRE.
column13: LA PROCEDURE PRETEND METTRE EN CONTACT UNE SOURCE DE LYCOPENE AVEC UN FLUIDE SUPERCRITIQUE SOUS CONDITIONS QUI PERMETTENT LA SOLUBILISATION DU LYCOPENE DANS LEDIT FLUIDE SUPERCRITIQUE, ET SEPARER LE CONCENTRE DE LYCOPENE SUIVANT REDUCTION DE PRESSION DU FLUIDE SUPERCRITIQUE CHARGE AVEC DU LYCOPENE. QUAND LA REDUCTION DE PRESSION SE REALISE JUSQU'A DES PRESSIONS INFERIEURES A 10 MPa ON OBTIENT UNE OLEORESINE ET QUAND ON LE REALISE A DES PRESSIONS SUPERIEURES ON OBTIENT UN EXTRAIT, LES DEUX RICHES EN LYCOPENE LIBRE DE DISSOLVANTS ORGANIQUES. LE CONCENTRE ET LES COMPOSITIONS QUI LE COMPRENNENT ONT DES PROPRIETES ANTI OXYDANTES ET SONT UTILES POUR ELABORER DES PRODUITS ALIMENTAIRES, COSMETIQUES, PHARMACEUTIQUES OU NUTRITIONNELS.

column12: Dispositivo de columna de agua oscilante modular con turbina de flujo bidireccional
column13: La presente invención está relacionada con un dispositivo de columna de agua oscilante modular que se compone de una cámara de aire (1) y un sistema de flujo (2) que comprende un cono tobera-difusor inferior (3), un cono tobera-difusor superior (5), una malla de protección (6) y un techo para protección (7). Además de un sistema conversor de energía (4) que comprende una turbina de flujo bidireccional (10), unos direccionadores superior e inferior (9), unos conos direccionadores (8) y un generador eléctrico. El dispositivo de columna de agua oscilante se caracteriza porque cada sistema del prototipo es modular para facilitar su instalación y mantenimiento sin realizar obras civiles de gran envergadura. Su aplicación es para la generación de energía eléctrica en zonas costeras, en áreas de diversa intensidad de oleaje marino.

column12: FORMULATION OF A FOOD FOR RUMINANTS BASED ON PINE SAWDUST THAT IMPROVES DIGESTIBILITY FUNCTIONS AND PREPARATION METHOD.
column13: The present disclosure is related to a formulation and method to obtain a food for ruminants, which is preferably made from pine sawdust. Through physical conditioning to a specific size, sawdust improves its contact area by cellulolytic and hemicellulolytic microorganisms at the ruminal level, and therefore its digestibility; then, under a chemical process, the lignin contained in the substrate is reduced, also helping digestibility. The formula includes the processing of sawdust to obtain the optimum particle size required to generate the best digestive parameters from the use of this ingredient. In addition, sawdust is combined with different protein, energy and mineral sources to generate the highest levels of microbial degradation at the rumen level. This food allows increasing the digestive parameters, as well as the liver function, situation that is translated into greater biological and productive efficiency from the animal.

column12: METHOD FOR GENERATING A GRADUATED HYDROXIAPATITE/TITANIA COATING USING HVOF.
column13: The present invention relates to a process for manufacturing a hydroxyapatite/Titania (HAp/Titania) bioactive graduated composite coating by the high-speed combustion thermal projection method (High-Velocity Oxygen Fuel HVOF). Also, it relates to its microstructural characterization and mechanical on Ti-6AI-4V substrates. Said coating aims to work as a link between a prosthesis installed in a bone system to favor osteosynthesis between them, providing structural rigidity to the metal implant. Also, it aids osteosynthesis and the mechanical stability of the surface during its interaction time with body fluids.

column12: Dispositivo para Autorehabilitación Pasiva de Rodilla no supervisada
column13: Modelo de Utilidad Dispositivo para Autorehabilitación Pasiva de Rodilla no supervisada Se presenta un dispositivo de movimiento pasivo continúo para realizar autorehabilitación de rodilla. Este, comprende una entrada motriz que es introducida manualmente por el paciente de tal manera que la limitante de dolor pueda ser controlada directamente por éste, realizando un movimiento de extensión y flexión de rodilla voluntario. El dispositivo contiene un mecanismo de manivela, biela, corredera que transforma la entrada motriz de desplazamiento angular en lineal para ajustar diferentes etapas de rehabilitación que varían desde 170 grados hasta 90, medidos entre muslo y la pierna y que dan los movimientos de extensión y flexión en la rodilla. Dicho mecanismo además posee un sistema de bloqueo angular que sirve de indicador para verificar cada una de las fases de avance en los movimientos realizados para la rehabilitación y por su simetría se utiliza tanto para la rodilla izquierda como la derecha.

column12: Dispositivo para extraer muestras
column13: La presente invención corresponde a un dispositivo para extraer muestras de sedimento, que comprende un tubo con un primer extremo y un segundo extremo, y un acople conectado al primer extremo. Por su parte, el acople tiene un cilindro con un extremo superior y un extremo inferior, donde el extremo inferior del cilindro se inserta dentro del tubo a través del primer extremo; y una primera tapa conectada al extremo inferior del cilindro, y localizada dentro del tubo, donde la primera tapa tiene al menos un conducto. Además, el dispositivo tiene una válvula dispuesta dentro del cilindro. La válvula tiene un émbolo dispuesto encima de la primera tapa; donde el émbolo se localiza sobre el conducto de la primera tapa.

column12: PROCESS FOR OBTAINING AN ADSORBENT MATERIAL FROM THE BANANA SHELL AND ITS USE FOR DECONTAMINATING HEAVY METALS IN WATER.
column13: The present invention discloses a process for obtaining an adsorbent product, which helps remove heavy metals from water, specifically mercury. Said process begins with the collection and cleaning of the banana peel confining in it, in closed containers to avoid contamination, thereby ensuring the elimination of moisture. Also, the process is carried out through temperature changes to generate different heat fluxes and improve dehydration time without losing properties. Once the dehydrated product is obtained, it is screened and placed inside the filter to eliminate the mercury content in water, decontaminating it to proportions of up to 0.7143 ppb.

column12: Method for the expression of heterologous genes in the yeast Pichia pastoris, expression vectors and transformed microorganisms
column13: The present invention provides a highly efficient method for the expression of heterologous genes, using as the host an auxotrophic his3 mutant of strain BKM-90 of Pichia pastoris and as recombinant DNA for the transformation thereof an integrative vector which contains a functional selection marker of Saccharomyces cerevisiae, the promotor of the alcohol oxidase gene (AOX1) of the yeast itself, as the transcription terminator that of glyceraldehyde 3-phosphate dehydrogenase (GAP) of S. cerevisiae, or that which is carried by the heterologous gene to be expressed, and another sequence homologous to the genome of Pichia pastoris which serves for the integration thereof. The expression vectors used further contain a heterologous gene bound to the signal peptide of the sucrose invertase gene (SUC2) of S. cerevisiae. This method guarantees that the polypeptide products are recoverable under controllable conditions and with high yields. The strains according to the present invention can be used for the large-scale production of pharmaceutical products or of enzymes of industrial interest.

column12: MONITORING AND ALERTING SYSTEM FOR THE PRESERVATION OF HEALTH.
column13: The present invention relates to a system and its process, through a technological platform for monitoring and alerting, which prevents infections or abnormalities early for the preservation of the health of confined people. It is useful in centers, educational institutions, lodgings, restaurants, and/or in any type of events, where there is an intention, obligation or need to take care of the health of individuals and people, generating timely information so that the entity and/or the medical service or health institutions take actions in each case presented by the platform. The Platform receives information from various peripheral devices (personal or mass capture) that emit signals, considered as sensors used to measure vital signs.
